reviewText:
In the short time I've played this I've-

-Shot flames out my rear end.

-Turned into a dragon.

-Built a space needle to the moon.

-Attended a mushroom coronation.

-Murdered everyone there.

-Rode a Velociraptor.

-Rode a Velociraptor as a dragon.

-Used the dragon baby I stole as a weapon of mass destruction.

-Met up with my friends.

-Raided 10,001 dungeons.

-Massacred the entirety of Texas.

-Killed some pirates.

-Become pirates.

-Got bored and killed pirates again.

-Built a 5-star hotel fortress.

-Stopped an evil overlord from returning from beyond the grave.

-Killed a family of spiders and lizards.

-Ate pie.

-Got drunk.

-Went to heal and died cause my flask was empty from being drunk.

-Came back from the dead.

-Killed those who killed me.

-Teabagged thier corpses.

-Saw a unicorn.

-Tried to burn said unicorn.

-Got &%# kicked by unicorn.

-Taunted best friends for not helping me.

-Profanity.

-Went to the beach.

-Bedazzled my nipples.

-Fished.

-Rage quit and lit fish on fire.

-Entered Tron.

-Killed Cuthulu.

-Destroyed aimbot.

-leveled up & got phat l3wts.

-Argue over who has better gear.

-Raid some more stuff.

-Danced.

-Danced as a dragon doing Gangnam style while my friends mudered a robot with weapons crafted from it's babies.


10/10 Would dragon dance while killing babies again.

reviewText:
I am genuinly shocked by this game. If I'm brutally honest, I loaded this up expecting to play a very amateur-ish game with little amusement value. I was entirely wrong.

Trove is, in many way, Minecraft with more RPG/MMO features put into it. The graphics are blocky and hugely varied, creating a really colourful and vibrant world. The sounds also fit the game style very well. A lot of the enemy voices are really quite funny, and difficult to decipher.

The building is somewhat basic, though there are a huge amount of blocks to be unlocked, some rarer than others. I find the way your own plot of land works interesting: there are plots all over the map, more are found in some biomes than others, and you can claim any of them as your own, where your house pops up. Any changes you make to this house stick with it. Then, you can just claim another spot, the other one disappears and your house has moved! It's quite cool, really, and stops the whole real estate issue a lot of games have (ArchAge).

There are currently 11 classes that all play very differently and have unique pros/cons. The combat is like that of an action RPG, with all abilities from enemies being dodgeable, if you have the reaction speed! The enemy AI is nothing particularly special, they essentially just run at you, but their attack patterns and visuals are different enough to keep you on your toes.

I feel Trove is a bit all over the place with how in depth it wants to be with it's RPG elements. There are lots of stats on your equipment (including magic find, I like!), but very few equipment slots compared to other MMOs. The classes all have really different gameplay, rare for an MMO, but each class only has a basic attack and 3 abilities. It's a little odd, if I'm honest, as though the developers were told to reign it in. I can understand that, but I do wish there was more diversity in choosing your abilities, as it can grow a little stale.

At first, I thought this was a good first MMO, and I think I will get my 7 year old sister into this, I think she'll enjoy it; however, after level 10, some of the enemies are actually pretty damn difficult. Pre-10 the game is very easy and offers little in the way of challenge, but it soon ramps up. Younger people may actually struggle with this game, but I think a lot of them would enjoy the building aspect, as well as the combat side.

To sum up: this is a great little MMO with loads of interesting features and fun gameplay. It'd be great for a first time MMO and for children, but offers challenge after the intro (first 10 levels) to keep anyone interested. With friends, it's very enjoyable seeing who can make the funniest looking character. It can get a little grindy after a while, but I would still recommend giving it a go and deciding for yourself.

Edit: I feel I should mention there are long queues. MMOs never keep up very well during the first few days of release, and this is no exception. Expect to be waiting in queues to play for a few days, unfortunately. Hopefully the servers will quieten down a bit in the next few days, or the developers will upgrade the servers to handle the load.

As of 13/07/2015, the queues are still quite long, they are apparently working on them all the time. Quite frustrating, unfortunately.

reviewText:
Trove is a Cubeworld-look-a-like MMO RPG game. Free, and fun!I've played the Alpha, and Beta. And my word is it only got better.. for the most part.

Pro's :Fun
HUGE amount of loot available
Easy to play, hard to master
Nice amount of classes available
Good Graphics, cartoon-ish
HUGE amount of players
Build your own portable house (Cornerstone)
And way, way more!

Con's :Due the unexpected amount of players, the servers aren't ready for the load. Thats why they implemented Queue's. Its very annoying but the only way of not crashing their servers and/or lagging all players.
Not optimised as the best.
-Edit: The Queue's have been eliminated!

I hope you liked my review. Its my first one. I'm not going to ask you to use my friend code etc. If your relly want, just add me and we can talk.

reviewText:
Good game 8.5/10

Pros
-Endless worlds and dungeons of various difficulties to explore
-You start with a mount, and eventually get ships, wings, and mag carts later on
-Can build your own POH and can deploy it wherever you go and see a hotspot
-Tons of loot, which you can destroy to gain it's appearance and mastery points
-Crafting system works well, later tiers will have you grinding a lot of mats though
-Seemless class switching
-Not P2W (everything can be bought with in game currency except for a few exlusives and cash shop cosmetics)
-Very addictive
-Admin team, keeps users updated frequently and in a timely manner, quickly responding to issues
-Can instantly teleport to other players currently fighting, this includes people in your club and your friends
-Loot is not shared, what you see drop is for you, hitting a monster at least once grants items/xp
-If you are close enough ore mined is shared with everyone nearby

Cons
-Can get repetitive, if u  play in large doses
-Lacks viable trading platform, i.e. auction/trading system, but you can still trade person to person or at a trading post
-Long que times, but be honest what MMO after launch doesn't have this issue with a sharp increase in user base
-Minor bugs causing a disconnect and reconnect issues, rare and admins are aware of it
-Class skills are limited

reviewText: Trove is the perfect compilation of some of the greatest PC games. It has the art style and visuals of Minceraft, the exciting boss battles and loot drops of the Borderlands series, and the MMO aspect & RPG elements of Realm of the Mad God. Think of it as being a direct upgrade to Cube World... except it's free! Almost everything in the Trove store can be purchased using free obtainable credits which you recieve every single day you log in. It is super easy to add your friends in-game and begin questing and grinding resources for your Club". Your "Club World" is basically an entire realm dedicated to the creations of you and your friends. Overall
date: this game is amazing! If I had to
recommended: I would have payed for this game. The fact that a game which clearly took plenty of effort and care to create is free just boggles my mind. Literally download this game right now!"

reviewText:
--------SOLD ALL MY IN-GAME ITEMS, PLEASE STOP ADDING ME FOR THEM--------

After spending 1500 hours on it and quit the game, I have so much things to say out of it;

It's a very good idea done exactly wrong. Don't get me wrong, I ENJOYED the game and the community is generally nice.

However, the game developpers are so incompetent it's unreal, we're talking about 2 to 18 hours downtime every few days outside of a weekly tuesday patch that takes hours also.

The game's laggy as ♥♥♥♥ sometimes it's unplayable, it's buggy and while there's a lot to do in this game, in a way, it has no content whatsoever. It's a mmo, i know it's meant to be repetitive, but Trove takes repetitive to a whole new level.

I feel like trove alpha and trove nowdays got 2 different teams, one that got the idea and one that's trying to milk it with pack$. they seem to be barely able to fix or balance anything, they just come up with more useless allies and mounts(let's not mince words here, 99% of the mounts are just reskin since they all do the same thing)

I used to be on the top of the leaderboards all weeks since DOTM got released(ign HolyQ if someone recognizes it) full radiant weapons and armors, mastery 200(290) or so. I kinda sucked at building but managed to do small things regardless. The community in general knows Trove isn't gonna change much but they are hoping really hard, but there are some major issues that aren't adressed at all still. Pack$ and ¢ontent seems to be more important.

Don't get me wrong on the ''hourly challenges'', they're plain stupid. You could just follow a mass of laggy players and you could do your challenge which rewards the same thing everytime.

I'll miss this game, but I quit it because I know it won't change for the best.

reviewText:
After long time i can already tell Trion is getting Trove in wrong way.
Here's why:

Trove was fun little grinding game where you could just get on and play for 1-15h straight. It was a simply fun game that evolved into another good game being destroyed by Trion.

Why destroyed you ask?TrionWorlds likes to put paywalls in their games (@ArcheAge.) Trion recently pushed update not long ago. (1 week) Which brought to us Power Rank and Paid Classes (Previously these could be earned for free by collecting enough cubits, now you can only pay with credits which require to buy $19,99 pack in order to get 2 classes and so on...) I don't mind Power Rank but, seriously Trion? Paid classes? That's like stealing kid's candy!

Why it isn't right?Playing Trove was more valuable than now. Power Rank has completely nerfed some Great characters (@Revenant)  They also managed to nerf Revenant to that state that it's Useless class now. (Previously it was so good that you could easily solo U6 before) Classes aren't just nothing. They can be strong, they can easily defeat each biome if upgraded correctly. They also give mastery if you level them up. Making them priced was Trion's big Fail in whole Trove history. Like i said, i can resist Power Rank, i can resist any bad updates, but >NOT< TrionWorlds P2W concept!

I'm now only starting up Trove to get my daily chaos chest and nothing more. This update broke my relationship with Trove and Trion itself. :(

I will change this review if i'm not going to expect another paidwalls in next updates (3 months)
For now i'm staying negative. That's your fault Trion. You destroy fun. You lose fanbase... and what? You still don't care!

EDIT #1: TrionWorlds created another P2W update for Trove. This time players will get -500 Cubits (500 Cubits) and Patron will get +50% (1k Cubits) for filling star bar. This game is becoming trash.

EDIT #2: And i got perma banned off Trove discussion. Nice!

EDIT #3: Power of Mantle Head Start shouldn't exist. They should wait and then release it f2p, not just to push it on and make scrubs brag about it. Prices: Simple 14,99 Euro. Fanatic: 37,50 Euro. Maniac 74,99 Euro and they even overpriced it as ♥♥♥♥.

EDIT #4: Atleast they buffed up Shadow Hunter. Which is kinda good 'cause nobody uses that class anyway

EDIT #5: Lucky Clovers for 25 Credits. Other stuff for 50 Credits. Welcome to Power Of Money™

reviewText:
Half my gametime is queuing up to join a server. (Update: The server wait times have supposedly been massively improved!)

Just kidding. The real review:

Trove.. What a surprise it has been, as always with F2P's I expected a pay to win element, however none such is present here. Albeit the usual shortcuts are available for players if they wish to take advantage of it, or support the developers.

Gameplay wise, it's a pretty fun game. Level up and raid dungeons alone or with a team and enjoy the loot! Another aspect as you'd expect from a Minecraft looking game is building. This is much more difficult to achieve as most decorations require a lot of materials to create.

That being as it is, building is definately not the main focus of the game, more of a way to show off your skill and wealth in the game.

Nothing much else to say, really fun game and I haven't paid a penny out, nor felt forced to spend anything.

reviewText:
I started playing this since it was in Open Beta, and it's just as fun as it was back in Beta, especially with the new content that's been added since I started.

Pros:
Beautiful, clean graphics that, although blocky, give it a nice, creative world.
Promotes user creativity, since it has a forum for designing weapons, costumes, dungeons, etc.
Pretty easy to get into and understand how everything works. The rotations are fairly easy to figure out, and so is the crafting and the forging.
The weapons, faces and hats are VERY customizable without the trouble of a complicated transmogrifier system.
Almost entirely free to play. There is some stuff that you can pay actual money to get quicker, but for the most part, spending actual money is entirely optional.
Sharing system that makes gaining materials pretty easy.
VERY wide range of classes to choose from, and you can switch between them anytime you want (assuming you buy them with Cubits, anyway).
Cons:
If you aren't lucky enough to make it to the end of a dungeon on time, when someone else defeats the boss and opens the chest, your hard-earned loot will despawn.
Salt. Salt. Salt. So much salt in the community, though most of it is in the Trading chat.
LONG QUEUE TIMES. RIDICULOUSLY LONG QUEUE TIMES. I get that Trion didn't anticipate how popular their game would be when it launched on Steam, but PLEASE fix this.
The gameplay is pretty repetitive, since most of it involves going to dungeons to get your currency and loot. The closest to a quest system available are Challenges, which can only be done once you've hit Mastery Rank 30, and they only happen once every 20 minutes or so. Plus, all you get out of them is flux (one of the main currencies in the game) and Boxes.
It's a bit boring if you play alone. Having a group of friends makes everything a lot more fun.
These are the only things that come to mind, but I'm sure there's a lot more.

In conclusion, I DO recommend this game, because it's pretty fun and time consuming. I'd give it about a 7.5/10, but if Trion fixes it's servers then I'd give it a higher rating.

The new Trove experience as of Mantle of Power has be a mixed feeling for me.

Cons:

-Class gems are ESSENTIAL, but for some classes it ruins them-
-Having alts now really isn't an option-

Overall Trove still has it's original charm, but the negatives of the new expansion really outshine what is acctually a great addition. Hopefully they listen to the players and make it less of a grind.

-From, A Trove Lover

reviewText:
The downfall of a game that was once my life
With nearly 800 hours logged on Steam and a few hundred hours logged before the Steam release, it kills to me say that over the passed year this game has spiralled into something that I can no longer bare to watch burn.

Unplayable lag, microtransactions that are necessary to enjoy the later aspects of the game, worst community I've ever seen within a video game, unfriendly to any player just starting. I truly pity anyone who has tried to get their start within the passed few months.

I am Mastery 208, my Fae Trickster is rank 300 in the game, and yet I still feel useless. No matter how much you grind, or even if you do pay money, you will never feel satisfied with what you have. The newest update regarding gems is what pushed me over the edge and why I will no longer play, because no matter how much money you pay, even 20 dollars will only last to max one empowered gem.

The developers don't listen, the players who spent hundreds of dollars to max themselves put down the poor players and act like nothing is wrong, content is limited within grinding/building/ and luck.

Trove is purely RNG based nowadays, though I can hardly say it is random, for one of the devs confirmed that the system is rigged against the players.

Don't bother with Trove, it's more trouble than it's worth. Really hurts to leave the memories of this once beautiful game behind.

(Check this box if you received this product for free) No, one does not simply play Trove for free.

After a decent amount of time, I think I can give you guys an overview of Trove. If you like my review or not, feel free to like/ dislike and comment on it.

Pros:- balanced classes, even if you only have 4-5 skills to use
- fun with friends for a period of time
- funny and innovative dungeon design, like Candoria (Candyland) and Dragonfire Peaks (fire and dragons)
- biome designed dungeons
- no pay2win
- A LOT of styling items
- fun through the first 20-25 levels
- interesting and innovative building mechanics
- enhancements in weapons and armor
- fighting system is very active

Cons:- bag expension etc. will cost up to 50€ if you want to unlock every bag
- no new expensions, just a lot of new shop items (stlye etc.)
- late/never answering support
- it's fun, for 2-3 weeks, it gets repetitive
- no pvp at all
- same biomes all the time
- a lot of grinding in your professions like gardening or ring-crafting
- after a while you just run through the dungeons to kill the boss
- mastery level 30 and full radiant gear means you've beaten the game, there is no late game" content

All in all

reviewText:
It is obvious that Trove has become too greedy in its shop changes and terrible in its implemented game design.

-This is surprisingly not the biggest problem with Trove right now.-

Ever since Live, you can see the gap of meaningful content production correlates to your player numbers dropping. Meaningful content defined as adventure world updates (combat, quests and dungeons), crafting, and building.

[MONEY]
I also fear that any game that you can spend hundreds ($300+ personally) on isn't enough to get everything. While somehow the devs claim that there isn't any incentive to develop and update a system unless a price tag is directly on that feature.

But Trove does have incentive to update content and classes. That's what everything else in the cash shop was for. The devs clearly don't understand that though.

[CLASS COST CHANGE]
Classes didn't need to be pay for only. There was plenty in the store and $20 packs people were buying including myself to keep the game going strong. And those packs are filled with items players made giving devs the free time to make content. The devs didn't even hold up their end.

[FORCED GAME PLAY]
Another problem is that Mantle of Power essentially divides the community. Not because of power or even RNG, but because of Shadow Tower itself. We thought Shadow Tower was going to do that before until the community found out how to avoid it entirely since it had nothing to do with the adventure world. But MoP was designed to force it to be an integral part of the game to advance. Its promises of adding more abilities and content is just a cosmetic paint job for both with no real substance.

We waited a year for the same worlds only with gaps in between dungeons and a gear RNG that makes no sense but to put lucky/rich players in a different league from everyone else.

[SAYING ONE THING, DOING THE OPPOSITE]
This leads to the biggest problems which is the devs' two-faced policy. That may be a cruel thing to say but it is an honest criticism that the devs must face. We don't want too much RNG into the game." Gems. "We want to feel like players are progressing." Nerf then add new stuff to farm to regain that lost power. Actions entirely money driven. Ever since the game went live the team has done an about-face to meaningful content production.

It has stopped growing and instead added money dependent systems without doing anything substantial as thanks. Remember the content added thanks to dragon caches in the shop? What about making classes credit only? MoP is a result of that
date: asking you to spend more money not for cosmetics but for numbers that mean nothing.\n\nThey didn't lose money because of these decisions
recommended:
but because of the lack of decisions to advance adventure world and building content. The things this game was founded on.

[LEFTOVER POPULATION DEPENDENCY]
You are losing players from such greedy decisions in every system you add to Trove. To think where we would be if the number of players that Live and Steam added to the game stayed. This would have come to be if the dev team kept their Alpha and Beta momentum and kept advancing the content rather than pack in cash grab only systems. You would have had a large enough population to keep your pockets full while providing more content that is fun to play and not grind intensive. Including new classes and more abilities to former ones.

[RETURN TO A FORM OF RESPECT]
Despite that gap that dropped your population to a petty fraction
hoursPlayed: you still have a chance to return to the team that your were in Beta. You have enough money systems to make this game last a lifetime
voteText:
so cut out the gem RNG and stick back to making money on the $20 packs and cosmetics (that players are making for you) and focus on actual content from here on out. Content development that people were brought into the game for in the first place.


[[TL ; DR]]
Think about how big Trove was in its first Live month and why. Its because of everything up to that point and none of anything that followed. Make your players happy as a priority

Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
3 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
1 tablespoon white sugar
1 1/4 cups milk
1 egg
3 tablespoons butter, melted

1. In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar. Make a well in the center and pour in the milk, egg and melted butter; mix until smooth.

2.Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium high heat. Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake. Brown on both sides and serve hot.

In 2013 Cube World was my favorite game. YOU KNOW how that story ends. So early on I was looking for a replacement and bought into Trove in the very early pre-alpha stage of dev. The game was cool but it was bare bones and didn't fill the void that Cube World left. Fast forward about a year or more and the devs have pushed the game into a great direction.

Pros:
- plenty of interesting classes to play and easy to unlock
- plenty of biomes and bosses and dungeons etc

reviewText:
Trove isn't bad per se, it just gets boring and repetitive really fast.

Yes, it's quirky, humorous, colorful & generally oozing a positive vibe. Yes, there is strong community aspect & some user created content can be awe inspiring. Yes, there are certain really nice game mechanics, like for example your cornerstone - a house of your own that you build & that you can place & relocate everywhere you want with a single button press. Also the music can be dreamy (Neon City <3).

Basically it's good to goof around for a bit, log in daily for a short while and log off. But as far as progression goes it requires a lot of time and repetition. Whether it's crafting, building, unlocking new classes or raising your mastery level - it all takes insane amounts of mats/currency & grind.

Sure the maps and dungeons are randomly generated. Sure, the dungeon design is quite fresh and can be very imaginative (or confusing ;). Sure, there are plenty of funny classes to choose from. But most dungeons are short (find boss, kill boss, take loot, get out) and sooner rather than later you learn all the design patterns and the novelty that came with it wears off (especially when you need to farm bajilion of them). Classes are very basic: main attacks - left click & right click, and 2 additional skills only. And they also take long to unlock, so if you happen to pick one that doesn't suit you, you'll struggle on your way to unlocking the next. And even if you pick a fun one, after a while you'll get bored with it, because there is only one way to play a certain class, and you'll be repeating the same combat pattern over and over.

Crafting is done via stations. Each station contains a list of items/things/portals/mounts/stuff you can make. To be able to craft other things, you need to craft other stations. You end up with  several of them placed in your cornerstone and have to remember which allows you to make what (or go through them & all the lists top to bottom, every single time you're trying to make a specific item). Not the most elegant of solutions. Anyway, for some things you'll need hundreds (if not thousands) of materials, that you can obtain by harvesting in the world (right click in build mode, that you can switch to anytime) or by killing stuff, completing dungeons and disassembling loot in via the loot collector. Also some crafting branches you have to level up by making hundreds of items, before you're allowed to make anything decent.

Building requires a lot of blocks as well (especially larger guild projects), but actually the building part is the least obnoxious aspect of Trove and doesn't take any extra effort than say Minecraft.

Because of all the things mentioned above you'll find yourself either running around & right clicking (=collecting) materials from the game world for prolonged periods of time or doing those fast dungeons ad infinitum. Once in a while you'll place your cornerstone in order to maybe craft or build something, just to be reminded of how much stuff you still need to obtain.

Like I said, Trove is good to log in once in a while, play around & log out (especially if you don't care about achieving anything specific). It's a pretty neat time waster if you have no games to play or just don't feel like doing anything else. Unfortunately I have a whole backlog of games I'd rather be playing over this and I'm not blessed with overabundance of time to kill, so I won't be playing Trove anymore.

reviewText:
First of all, I have played this game an insane amount before the steam release.  I am mastery level 110 and greatly enjoyed the game with multiple of my friends.

With the June update however we all stopped since Trion has ruined the endgame and does not seem to go back on their mistake.

What happened that ruined the game?   Challenges got added,  once you are mastery level 30+ you *can*  do challenges. However before challenges came out you were free to play the game however you liked, casually fishing, doing dungeons, exploring etc and still making a small profit out of it.

But then, everything changed when the fire nation attacked...
I mean After challenges got added it all changed and unfortunately for the worst. Every first 20 minutes of the hour you have to go to a certain zone and play with a certain class they pick for you instead of the one you enjoy the most ( sure you could play your favorite class but get your challenge points at one third of the normal speed which makes it insanely hard to get the higher rewards ).
These challenges give you insane and I mean insane rewards concerning materials and the main currency ( flux ).

Every other way of gathering flux has been deemed worthless due to this and as a proof of this the prices of everything in the game went up dramatically.  Skins that sold for 4.5k are now sold for 45k,  aka with normally playing the game you'd have to farm 10 times as long while 45k is easy as pie with challenges.
To make things even worse the challenges are simply done in a huge zerg since that is more efficient than doing it solo and it's overflowing with leachers and bots.

Long story made short, the economy and community was ruined with the challenge patch.

Now to make matters EVEN WORSE,  this was always a fun f2p game with a cash shop on which I've spend quite some cash and I've heard of people spending over thousands of dollars on it.
However with the latest patch they now added premium accounts that give such insane bonuses such as insane magic find to have way higher chance to find rare items compared to free users and multiple free jumps. There are more bonuses but these alone are already ridiculous.

All in all I greatly greatly enjoyed this game for hundreds of hours but it's done now unless the pay2win mechanics are removed.  I don't mind throwing cash at skins and fun mounts etc but pay2win is a no go and their lame challenge mode sucks.


edit:  you can no longer unlock the classes by playing the game HAHAHA. Oh man this is simply hilarious.  You now have to rely on people buying tradable class-coins with real money and them selling it to you for ridiculous prices.
I already had all the classes anyway but man this is such a slap in the face for new players.
voteText: 405 of 660 people (61%) found this review helpful 45 people found this review funny

reviewText:
What do I say about Trove? It really pushes how its like minecraft, but different.


This game is nothing at all like minecraft, and that's not a bad thing.

I've played my share of terrible games trying to feed of of Mojang's (now Microsoft's) sucess, and this game does not belong in that catagory at all.

This game is most certainly its own beast, and im actually very disappointed that the game's PR department is pushing the game as a 'Like Minecraft, BUT' games.


As for the game itself, its a highly refined MMORPG, full of a varitey of classes, weapons, and more comical items than you could shake a stick at. The biomes in this game are all very memorable, with adorable characters that had me questioning my protagonists' motives. The world is deadly, with portals scaled for difficulty, with increasing rewards as teired world go higher, into the 'UBER' levels and above. Constant new realms are created, making sure that the randomly generated worlds don't become entirely looted and scarce of resources. For a large part of the game, mining is entirely avoidable, except at higher levels where you need to craft entranes (called Adventure Portals) I do wish that there was a quicker method of mining, but i'm fine using the 'mining laser' or bombs to collect my shapestone.  The F2P system is also excellently designed, with premium accounts earning extra rewards for things such as dungeons, and a few exclusive items.


All over all this is an excellent MMORPG action/exploration game. Its very quirky and well designed, with all the in game systems working quite brilliantly with each other. Progression feels slow at times, but is very very rewarding. Lastly, this game IS NOTHING LIKE MINECRAFT.

reviewText:
There was a time that I really enjoyed Trove.  Without being too long-winded, the game simply changed into something that is no longer fun for me.  How you acquire dragons with hourly challenges, the new gem system, and the focus on Patron (subscription status) really turned a fun and casual free-to-play game into a chore where you have to spend money to make meaningful progression.

At first glance, the Mastery system is nice but after some time it becomes very evident that grinding purchases, with real money and in-game, just to get a higher Power Rank and Mastery level is too tedious for me.  The expansion added new levels to each class and in most games that’s nice.  In Trove, it feels like work now.  Leveling is slow and somehow more repetitive from 20-30 on one class than the 1-20 I’ve completed on eight other classes.  Not to mention, you can only buy classes with real money now.  Class leveling is a major way to increase Mastery rank and thus power.  Not being able to buy them with Cubits is a huge disappointment.

Basically, Trove became more effort than it was worth to me and with that I cannot recommend it.  With so many free and paid titles with more variety, better progression, and solid gameplay it seems like there’s just not room for a game were you have to grind for everything.  Other games offer a more enjoyable grinding experience and many other free-to-play games do not focus on getting you to spend money as much.

reviewText:
This game really feels like it SHOULD be good, but it's just too grindy and there just is not enough real content. Once you play for about a half-hour you have played the entire game.

It's got some really cool ideas that I haven't seen before, don't get me wrong, but it really needs just more to it. For example, there's spots in all the worlds where you can claim them as your home. Basically you build your home and take it with you into worlds. It can't be widened, but you can build it up extremely high or extremely low.

The game is also really easily accessible which is nice. It's about a GB in size and there's no party system. You just teleport to your friends and everyone auto shares loot and everything you pick up, even with other randoms that are roaming around.

That's about all the good parts tho. The combat is just too overly simple to really enjoy after a while. I'd say it's a bit more involved than most MMOs honestly, but with only 3 abilities there's only so much you can do.

The game really just needs to be less of a grind and give me more reason to have fun and build. I noticed there are community-dungeons" but there's no way for someone like me to make one. (There is a way
date: but it's a lottery if yours gets in and not a simple in game option.) In a game like this
recommended: everyone should be able to. Have people rate your dungeon and the better the rating the more chance it has to show up.\n\nAnyway
hoursPlayed: tldr; game is almost good but not enough it needs more to do and more fun to be had. Also the music is really boring and uninspired. It's decent for a free to play game though"

reviewText:
First off this is from a player who has spent 80+ hours playing. Would be more if this recent update didn't completely destroy progression.

Pros:
Fun engaging combat
Many weapons,armor,and various other things to collect.
Multiple biomes with unique bosses.

Cons:
Dispite it saying free,this is a pay2win game through and through.
With this most recent update (2/9/2016) they've made it so that in order to access areas of the game,you need to grind weeks if not months into obtaining items that all usually have the same stats so this means obtaining useless trash in large quantitites just to advance in the game. This makes progressing incredibly tedious and incredibly time consuming with the only reward being a couple ticks of points.
A recent update has made changing classes cost real money. You like that barbarian class? I hope you have a fat wallet. They've made obtaining classes only obtainable through real money and a in game marketplace.
Just yesterday I was able to unlock any class with little effort but due to them locking off our ability to unlock classes this way you're either forced to spend real money or buy incredibly overprice and inflated items that you might as well just spend real money on because they're ridiculously expensive.

Game cliant crashes all the time,bugs plague the game,clipping through walls and floors is normal,huge amounts of lag on monster computers is pretty normal too.


Yesterday I would have recommended this game but today after the newest game changes I would never recommend this game to anyone.

reviewText:
Trove was a good game... I put a lot of time in trove and enjoyed it... and with that said, it is now one of the worst games I know after the update of February 9th, 2016.

First Major mistake was nerfing Valorious Vial, Sure Strike, and Revnant. People had entire builds built around the Valorious Vial (vv) and Sure Strike (ss) such as myself). Making a 15 second cooldown on VV now turned it into the crapiest vial ever. SS, though a mere 1 second nerf, still makes a HUGE difference in overall gameplay... My problem with nerfing VV is this. Valorious Vial was expensive enough that it should have had that good buff of a 5% CHANCE of giving back one flask, that made it hard enough to regen flasks (other than revnant). I had a really hard time regening any flasks at all with my Lunar Lancer who used Sure Strike, I ran out of flasks during multiple boss battles. 5% chance was a small enough chance that Valorious Vial was not overpowered, but still usefull. now, it is IMPOSSIBLE to regen any flasks with VV and SS at ALL unless you are revnant, they nerfed it from being not overpowered and balanced, to useless... it is now one of the worst vials in trove. May I also say that it costs 35K flux, so I think it having a decent buff is okay for it's price. it is a later game vial, so it should be good. Same with Sure Strike, it is 125K flux at the CHEAPEST, it is end game emblem, and I think it shouldn't be made worse. End game gear should be good, and it was balanced in the past, now they nerfed the combo to the point that even as a new player the combo is hardly useful.

For people who are looking to get this game, VV and SS were both really good emblems and vials of end game, most people built there classes around it. Trove seems to want to do this, take the things people like that are balanced, call them overpowered, and nerf them (a.k.a ruin them).

Luckily I went Lunar Lancer, but I feel horrible for the revnants. Nerfing VV and SS was enough to make any Revnant cringe... but removing 20K HEALTH turned them into a not so good tank. It made multiple people quit, and severly hindered the gamplay of half the tanks in trove, to the point where they aren't able to tank what they used to be able to.

For people who are looking to get the game, Revnant was a tanking class, while Lunar Lancer is a damage class. Revnant focuses on multiple targets at once, while Lunar lancer is more of a focus on one enemy.

Those are all horrible nerfs they made, but I could have handled that, though I would have severly disliked it, but making it so you have to use REAL MONEY to progress at all did me in, let me explain in FULL detail why this is so horrible. I speak for the new people and people with a small amunt of classes bought before the update. There will no longer be any diversity in trove, everyone will find the best starter class, and EVERYONE will go with the same class. Not only that, but they only get 2(!) class coins free (Trion says you get 3 free, but you have to BUY something with real money before you get the free" class). Then you can get Chloromancer free by putting some time into Rift which is annoying that you need another game to get a class... Then referral links

reviewText:
It's an MMO so of course it's going to be repetitive, but I think Trove actually found a way to make that fun. Its gameplay builds on the formula of Cubeworld's, a voxel/3D pixellated visual style (that looks great due to particle effects and lighting), fast-paced combat with usable skills and randomly generated worlds and dungeons. The mastery system gives reason to excessive grinding as well as character levelling and loot. So why am I negatively reviewing a unique and genuinely fun game?

Trion.

F2P and P2PI played this about a month before its exit from beta and Steam release, and the game was very light on its pay2play aspect. Classes and many goodies in the shop could be bought with Cubits (earnable currency), and most premium items were cosmetic or boosters.

Since the Steam release, they've added 4 content" packs that give nothing but cosmetics and wallet devotion points to Trion and are about to release another called Mantle of Power - while it is a content pack

reviewText:
I am uninstalling Trove as of now.

I've probably put 50 hours into this game over two weeks and there is no end in sight.

The Good:

- The voxels are crunchy
- The music is not grating
- There's a ton of 'stuff' to do
- The community is hella friendly.
- The endo hits are frequent and satisfying. Finding the next best thing or popping chests and getting rare loot is incredibly satisfying.

The Okay

- The classes are largely the same, and they all have their playstyle basically dictated from level 3. As you play it's just a seesaw of power between your equips and which portal you enter.

- All uprades aside from weapons and equipment are basically cosmetic once you get past starter. Wings, mounts, boats, there's a basic one and then you unlock another by grinding. It's nice because you don't get blown out by other people with super fast mounts, but you DO need to unlock cosmetics to advance your level, and everything else.

The Bad, or The Heart of the Review"

This game is a sugar coated addiction vampire. The bubbly exterior masks a system that encourages you to play

reviewText: Look, Trove can be a hell of a lot of fun and it would be one of my favorite games if it were singleplayer. However, it's obviously not; you're at the mercy of the servers' latency. For most games this is a non-issue, as the developers actually invest in decent server capacity. For a frenetic Action RPG where pinpoint accuracy and constant movement is always a factor, latency means everything.\n\nWhile you're out and about adventuring and getting addicted to this game, you're going to experience countless bugs, rubberbanding, lag, lag, and more lag. If an enemy is strafing you, you can hit them directly with a ranged attack MULTIPLE times and they won't take damage because of client/server desync. The same issue happens when clearing a dungeon; after finishing the quest a chest appears that you destroy to get gear. Usually this takes 3-5 attacks, however due to lag and desync you can be attacking a dozen times before the damn thing finally pops. Speaking of attacking, spamming skills can cause your character to be stuck autoattacking on some classes, which may or may not actually do damage. And there are no real options to resize the chat window or filter local" chat or club (guild) chat. Spam ahoy
date: and you have to install a mod to be able to get rid of the chat window. Brilliant.\n\nBut wait
recommended: there's more! Literally EVERY SINGLE major patch this year the developers have consistently made the game WORSE for new players. That's right
hoursPlayed: they are actively DISCOURAGING people from playing their game. Classes used to be purchasable with an in-game currency from daily rewards
voteText: and now you have to pay money or grind out tens of thousands of the equivalent of gold (flux in this game) and purchase a cash shop item from other players to unlock new classes. This most recent patch made it far more difficult for a new player to upgrade their gear to endgame level. And they always give a different BS reason when in reailty they're just trying to make more money by being scumbags. This is about on par with every other game published by Trion
helpfulPercent: and it doesn't look like they're going to get better any day soon. Absolutely friggin pathetic.\n\nThe game is incredibly fun and plays great... when it works. Then it gets pretty damn frustrating. If you're not prepared to be frequently frustrated by rubberbanding

votesFunny: and consistently regressive updates that make the game harder for new players

reviewText:
Being a breath of fresh air in the voxel style of games, Trove varies from it's similar titles in ways that are appeasing to the eye and the community. The first of it's kind aside from Cube World, Trove is a massive RPG that allows you the freedom to customize the way you play, the way your character looks, and your all-around experience of the game. Trove has improved greatly since its early days in Closed Beta. The course of the game is far more easy to understand, as you now have objectives pointing you in the direction of your journey.

One of the best parts of Trove is that it is not Cash Shop heavy, and most things can be bought with the in-game currency that is given to you by killing enemys completing quests. Mounts can be found as loot throughout the game, but can also be bought at a reasonable price. Companions, which are pets that will follow you around and attack enemies with you, can be found in the game as loot as well, but you can also buy them in the cash shop.

Trion Worlds did a great job on Trove's guild" mechanic. Instead of joining a guild full of players
date: you can join something  called a "Club"
recommended: which has it's own world and chat for you and your friends to have fun with.\n\nTrove's character customization is also one that deserves to be a lesson to other MMORPG's. You don't have to pay premium OR in-game currency to change the way your character looks. So if you don't like your character's appearance
hoursPlayed: or you simply want to try something new
voteText: it is at no cost to you whatsoever.\n\nThe community is a huge part of the Trove world. Hats and masks for you to wear are mostly made by the community themselves
helpfulPercent: which can be picked up. Credit is of course given to the person who made the face
votesHelpful: and they come up with some pretty creative names for the items.\n\nIf you don't like the way your class plays out
votesTotal: or you simply just want to try your hand at a different class
votesFunny: don't worry. You can pay premium or in-game currency to change your class. Don't like the way the Neon Ninja looks
commentsCount: and want to try your hand at another one
column16: the choice is yours for a small price.\n\nDo I recommend this game? Of course
column17: it's a great game with an ever-evolving community with very active developers who have been very calm during this hectic launch.\n\nI give it a 9/10"

reviewText:
I try to keep it short.

This review comes from a maxed out player, who began shortly after the beta was finished.
I had nearly anything archieved (Mounts, Dragon, Allies, Styles, Costumes) and had the best Equipment aswell as the money to buy everything i wanted.
(I have WAY more hours on the Glyph launcher.)

I loved this game, I really did.

There was no marketplace so it was nice to trade. You were able to archieve things in a reasonable time. The classes were able to be bought with currecncy you gained for logging in daily, which I think was a fair deal. The only thing you needed to pay for with real money was (like in many other games) cosmetics ,things which made things easier for you and some premium mounts which were avaible also from time to time for free-players.

I played this game without spending any penny and in the end i don´t regret. The greedy dudes from Trion rolled out like 3 patches which totally destroyed the game, its currency and they lost many of their members.

Let me briefly give you an insight of what they did:

-There are 12 Classes
earlier: all avaible after some period of time
now: 5 Classes for free rest needs to be bought with real money (or traded via Ingame-Market, but still needs to be bought from someone).
-Added a Power-Level which made it ridiculous hard for newbies to get a foot on the endgame content.
-Dragons which were able to be collected" durring a specific time and which have a serious impact on you Power-Level were now hidden behind a freaking hard grind time
earlier: 1 Dragon like 1-2 Weeks of time needed the additional earning could be sold to other players which were to lazy to do the missions
now: 1 Dragon like 8 Weeks of time needed and less additional stuff gained to sell (which is bad for economy)
Quote:  "New
recommended: $100 Credit Pack is now on the store. This pack contains $100 worth of Credits and a bonus tradable Golden Lunar New Year Egg
hoursPlayed: which immediately hatches Selene
voteText: the Celestial Storm
helpfulPercent: with no additional materials required!" -Thats the way grind it or buy it\n\nThis act of total contempt of the community made me giveaway all of my stuff
votesHelpful: say goodbye to everyone i had known in this game
votesTotal:
uninstall the game and write trion what i thought about the changes. Unfortunately they didnt care and kept going with this monkey business.


My conclusion:

If you are able to get a time travel machine i totally recommend you to play the game until there will be a patch name "Monkey Business". If you are a ULTRA tryhard and you like masochistical grinding this game is woth a try. But if you like a nice ballenced
votesFunny: fair F2P game with kind devs this game is the wrong attempt. ~ Love you Trion :*
commentsCount: never see you again\n"

reviewText:
I'm going to change my review once AGAIN, since this is like the new patch where it's almost game changing.

Ever heard of a game called maplestory? Ever played it BEFORE it was a 100% grind pay to win game? THIS IS TROVE!~ Remember in maplestory where you got HUNDREDS of people coming together to kill a boss like the pink bean? Well right now Trove is looking like a mmo where they have it RIGHT. I hope it doesn't turn into anything else, I love it how it is. The people are friendly, and the gameplay is awesome.

Pros:
Fun game
Different things to do:
-Building
-Grind(for money or for levels, take your pick)
-Shadow tower boss hype
Really different playstyle per character

Cons:
Not all classes are balanced TO the current patch.
(Some classes seem a bit more op now or more obvious to be a better class)
(Squishy characters seem to have lost their main use.)
Little kids who do not know how to sepll.(Intended)
May be overwellming to start funding gear.

reviewText:
I've played about 10 hours of this game while writing this review, so here it goes!

When I first saw the graphics in this game it just felt right, then I got into it and selected my class and went to it! The tutorial was straight forward and helpful. It puts you into the game real quick ( besides loading into the server.. ) I do reccomend playing this game with a friend, playing it alone is fun but it is way more fun with friends! I leveled with them, built with them and discovered new lands with them. I can say these 10 hours have felt like minutes and I expect to have many more hours in it!

PROS :
+Easy graphics on your computer
+Fun gameplay
+Lots of classes
+Good building and fighting experience
+Lots of items to pick through
+Large open worlds
+ITS FREE
+Good community (from what I've seen)
+Hard to greif
+Easy to add friends and quick teleport to them

CONS:
-Longish wait time for servers (20-30 mins)
-A few bugs
-Limited building room on plots of land
-Server lags occasionally (Probably due to popularity so this may change)



TLDR; It's a really fun game and it's free, you should try it out!

reviewText:
Woah. Uhh... Heh. Finally a game that absolutely blew away my expectations. Instead of it being some rpg money grab, thats pay to win, We have an absolute gem, in a sea full of fakes. This game, is true to it's name.

Let me tell you this game's loot system is so addicting, for example you may have, in another game with similar rpg elements, seen a weapon and only equipped it because it look's cool. Well in this you can customize the look's of your weapon to resemble an even cooler looking one, with better stat's. So basically the weapon has its same stat's, its damage, melee speed, however if you put any weapon into a loot thingy (I forget the name), makes it a free re-skin to any other weapon you currently obtain. It's very simple. Weapon A, with Weapon B's skin. And you get paid (in-game currencies) for it. Who ever said looting low level stuff, was a bad idea, right?

Update: I am addicted, this game is addicting. Update 2: FINALLY LOAD TIMES ARE BETTER!!!

You know what. This game, gives me hope. It really does, it really defines what a f2p game can be. Honestly, this is what might possibly be one of the best f2p games I have ever played. I am really, sitting pretty with this game, the fact that its so addicting, not pay to win, (Although some crafting recipes are a bit, well you know expensive).

reviewText:
I had to find the game on steam and download it there to finally be able to write a review. Not sure if the time I've spent grinding my way through this game will appear above my review or not, but I was one of the lucky few to say they were there when it started. You created an account, hopped over a hole in the ground, and went off on your adventure.

I was a naysayer at first but man, this game blew me away. There were a few things that got monetized, but it wasn't too big of a deal. Just mounts and classes basically, and you could get them with the currency you earn by playing. The community was astounding, most of the content in the game had been created by players. Looking at all the weapons and armor, you could see the individual credited for it's creation.

After some time, it was pretty obvious Trion spent much more time figuring out how to make the money and not how to properly code the game. A company needs money to survive and to keep delivering quality content to it's customers and Trion is known for only the first part. They have turned an incredibly addicting game into a paying simulator. Saving up for that awesome class with cubits you've earned by playing? Sorry little buddy, you have to spend money to get the classes now. So not only will the development of the classes be much slower (it already took forever for a new class to come out) but you won't be able to obtain them without spending money.
http://forums.trovegame.com/showthread.php?89417-Trove-Store-Unlocking-Classes
There's your link. It's truly upsetting to see Avarem post such a thing and I really see the game dying off because of it.

Some old players who already have everything unlocked will be absolutely loving it, because people like it when they have things others cannot get. And they will insult the people who don't have these things already and claim it's the greatest thing ever. But I can tell you, as an OG, this truly killed any hope of me coming back/continuing to play trove.
I know Trion, and their reputation for ruining their games (which are actually great by the way) just for money seems not  to be going away any time soon.

The absolute worst part is the bulk of the players are very young and just don't know when they're being screwed over and they'll only be bashed by the people who have everything when they finally step up and say hey this game sucks because I can't get anything. I will miss it, but I believe this to be wrong. Companies should not to these things to their customers and I truly believe the ratings for this game on steam will plummet for it.

reviewText:
Trove, by trion worlds
(while most of the stuff in this review is the same, check the bottom paragraphs for the main things keeping most long time players away, still worth a positive review as the hours i got out of it before it where ruined where worth it

just a side note before we get into the review, the game as of 30/12/2015 is very oriented towards new players, it doesnt reward returning players who are max level and high masterys, with some tasks like getting to mastery 100 and doing things that can give you boosts that can take  over 150 on their own not helping even a smidge in PVP and making very little differance to farming and dragon challenges in the high ubers

now here is my review of Trove, by trion worlds

trove is a voxel based casual mmo, what does that mean? it means the game is more relaxed than games such as WoW and has a blocky almost minecraft like look.
personally my favourite mmo as it is a pretty calm enjoyable experience

Pros-
game is free, in game purchases are an option, and wont hinder your gameplay if you decide to opt out

always new content, as you progress through the game, theres always a new challenge, always a new task or item to get or complete. thus making the game never feel empty, with weekly updates helping too

graphics, the game looks pretty good, with hundreds of clothes and weapon styles that have been player made adding to the large array of unique content not to be seen in any other game (apart from the odd pop culture reference here and there)


Cons-
some grinding can be a drag, its never too bad, it never gets to the point where you're aobut ot have a mental break down, goals are always reachable and fair, but sometimes can take alot of work to achieve.

servers, as the game is still fairly new, you can expect the odd server crash once in a while, and if the servers arent crashing, then they have a tendancy to run slowly, making navigatin difficult as the ground beneath your feet disapears.

community- while note all players are bad, there are a lot of minges, spammers, trolls, scammers about theses days, however with the recent addition of a report spam button the population of minges is decreasing

Trade- pretty much its too easy for new players to get a hold of rare items, the economy is bust at the moment, good for new players, bad for returning or current players


summary-

the game is fun,free,laid back, at first i was hesitant but now its become a hobby, not an addiction though. if you where thinking of picking up the game you might as well start as of now (2/10/2015) as rare loot, pickups and others things are way too easy to get right now, the game is definatly trying to welcome new people.

so what are you waiting for? go play it!

(written at 2 am, excuse me if i made some errors)


Edit- as of 30/12/2015----------------

with the new PVP update i decided to boot up trove again, after the patcher was finished and i'd loaded in i noticed a new building in the hub world. the building was the dedicated portal holder of the PVP arena portal, i went in, and was met by a very long load screen trying to find a game, upon actually finding a match i was sad to see that there are no mounts, no special buffs from weapons ro dragon challenges or anything, everyones levels are averaged out, so low end players get stupidly high boosts and people with max level characters get smacked down by the devs at trion worlds,

summary- in pvp its who hits first capture the flag, its slow paced and theres no 1v1 mode for smashing people, theres is also no way to fight others without the horrible level adjustments, meaning you wont be able fight off thousands of noobs with your max characters.

Edit- as of 26/04/2016----------------

so i went into trove again, what a mistake that was, it seems you can only buy classes with real money now, atleast thats what people in global chat where claiming, i wouldnt know, i have all of them.

then, i see that if you where a top level player, with super high mastery and max character level (42) (power rank around 2k) you are now practically nothing, having to be a power rank of something like 10k to get into the new" worlds.

side note: if you see people running around on dragons and you want one
recommended: now instead of getting souls from caches as the main way of getting dragons you need to get something like 300 dragon coins which are now only a drop and cant be traded along with about 200k flux

reviewText:
+: Combines aspects from other games in a way that makes the game truly unique in its own way.
+: One of the only if any MMO's that allows you to dig on the terrarian itself (although you can't build on the terrain unless it's in your own 'cornerstone' which is basically your own portable headquarters that you craft things at).
+: For an MMO this game took an interesting style of graphics that I haven't seen done before (in an MMO).
+: A bunch of classes to chose from, all seeming quite different from one another.
+: The game is free.
+: Can be a good MMO for someone who's never played one.
+: You can 'deassemble' a weapon or accessory you don't want to turn it into crafting materials that you may find more useful.

(Stating this) Many reviews on here say that the problem with the game is that it takes so long to connect to servers but this has been fixed (to my understanding).

-: Although there is a huge arsenal of weapons (that you are pre-assigned based on your class e.g. Shadow Archers will ONLY receive bows) none of them actually change the way you fight or for that matter give you any feeling of variety.
-: You progress so quickly that an item you picked up that you may have considered to be really good at the time can quickly become outdated in terms of stats. The game tries to make you feel good with this system of constant rewards and progression although it fails because you don't actually feel accomplished.
-: No storyline, NONE.
-: This game is repetitive, most of your objectives in this game are basically 'kill this and receive this' or... 'mine this and receive this'.  Due to there being no storyline you find yourself asking 'why am I even doing this?!'.
-: No actual quests, you have a pre-determined set of quests that every player in the entire game is also doing. You have no freedom to do what you want (that is if you want to actually make progress within the game), you MUST complete the assigned quest to move onto the next one.
-: The  entire game  is randomly generated making there feel like there's nothing to actually explore, it's just randomly generated terrain and dungeons (that also seem to be very repetitive).
-: You must make an account for the game itself, this isn't so bad on its own however it can be very frustrating trying to get your verification code from your email to work (both me and my friend had the problem).
-: Character customization itself is bad, (not the hats, there's plenty of those). there aren't many color options, as far as physical traits just about all you can do is change your skin color (e.g. you cannot change your height, width, etc.).
-: Things in the tutorial seem to be out of order, for example around my first hour of gameplay I was being being told the buttons used to attack even though I had already killed loads of enemies.
-: Does not have very much music.
-: All drops are marked as uncommon/rare+ when it comes to the rarity tag of an item, I've never seen a single item marked as 'common'. I feel the game does this to make you feel more accomplished.

This game has/had a lot of potential, it really did. Sadly I have to say that I must give this game a 4/10 for the reasons listed above.

reviewText:
Best game ever, I'll even rate a really good score.
This is maybe a somewhat negative review but I still like this game and I'll give it a thumbs up.

*So let's start with the content.

1. This game's graphics are flawless.

2. The gameplay and combat is marvelous specially it's a 3rd person RPG.

3. The mechanics like weapons, dungeons, wings, allies, mounts, etc. are made perfectly.

*So what are the bugs and issues in this game?

1. The first one is , itlacks regions. They should really add Asian server hosts for other people to join to have more fun and better connection/ping.

2. When I started the game and it enters the world, it sometimes pauses and is needed to be shutted down and restarted.

3. Suddenly disconnects in Adventure worlds, most likely in Uber 4-6 worlds.

4. Unbalanced classes like the new classes (Revenant, Lunar Lancer and Chloromancer) maybe because the skills and strategies of the old classes are really just hard to manipulate.


Overall I'll give a 9/10 in this game and in fact you should really play this.
I'm waiting for an update that will change a lil' bit of the gameplay like the PVP systems and not just updates for new classes, mounts and etc.

reviewText:
Despite Trion's questionable history with free-to-play multiplayer games (Looking at you, Archeage), Trove is an incredibly fun time sink.

Trove offers a multitude of actions and activites to do in the vast worlds it offers, and it's interesting combat system keeps you alive with the amount of dungeons and raids there are. Friends and clanmates are recommended to get the most of the game's club system.

Unfortunately though, the high latency has a habit of ruining the game's enjoyability, with your character often doing no damage on direct hits, and enemies dealing damage while you're far away.

Recommended to players who are willing to put time into the game, and aren't discouraged by a little desync and damage.

reviewText:
Went to play for the first time, got put in a 1000+ player queue with an estimated wait time of more than 30 minutes. And then, to add insult to injury just as I got near the front the game crashed and I was back at the end. Moving on to something I can play NOW.

Tip for the developers: attracting new players is key to growing your community. Putting them in a queue the first time they play will just send them someplace else. Let first time players jump the queue, and then if they like the game they'll be willing to wait the next time.

Also, get more servers to meet the demand, or you'll also lose the players you already have.

reviewText: It was great. WAS great. I played from the start of the Steam release up until late May, when I finally called it quits. The game had slowly been getting pickier and pickier with how much progress you can make without purchasing anything (classes, gem boosters/regeminators/etc) and the new players were left in the dust while old veteran players were rewarded just for existing. I had faith in Trion throughout a lot of it, even when classes were switched to real money only, and when the awful gem system was introduced. I put in too much faith. The game kept on spiraling downwards. Timegates, broken updates, it all became a huge disaster.\n\nIt doesn't help to have some gripes with the staff. The whole community was told multiple times that the first person to find a duplication bug and report it would get 100k credits." if the bug was found and fixed. I reported one
recommended: and yet I got nothing. Really? I could care less about the credits
hoursPlayed: but the fact that I was promised I'd get them and didn't is my issue. The least they could do is say "oh hey thanks for reporting that." Instead
voteText: I'm ignored and they just continue on with updating more and more

reviewText:
A great and fun MMO worth giving a go
I had some issues with the game upon steam launch and down the line but all is well now and the game is playable without such things as queues, black screens and lag.

+Free
+Pets
+Colorful graphics
+Has trading cards
+Building and crafting
+Vehicles and mounts
+A lot of classes to choose from
+Wide array of things to build and craft
+Can customize your character somewhat
+Clubs, which is essentially clans, you can recruit, play together, have your own club chat and also build your own club world

-No party system
-Quests are terrible, barely even quests
-Gets really difficult, higher tier worlds are not soloable
-The game is really grindy, you have to grind tons to progress
-Simple combat and character progression, boring to be honest
-Patron pass, like a membership, gives what I find to be unfair benefits
-Paid content, in game store, you can buy cosmetics but also things that help you tons in game, while it is fair play since the game is free I find it unfair to make it easier for those who have money

Download Size: 800mb
Trading Cards: 9 cards in the set

I enjoyed the game while I actively played it so I'm going to recommend it although the way you can buy almost if not everything you need really annoyed me. If you like building and crafting you may like the game, if you are looking for a great MMO with epic battles I'd advise against this game. The combat is simple and not much to it, so if thats what you are looking for best move on.

reviewText:
Before you scroll past this; please look at how many hours I have invested in this game.
Trust my words about this game; I've learned through experience.

This game is a giant money pool; don't waste your time on it.

Many argue this game is totally not pay-to-win; but in reality it REALLY is.

The developers are becoming more and more greedy with each new update.

The community is full of children spamming global chat CONSTANTLY asking for free stuff.
-About 75% of traders WILL try and seriously rip you off.

The newer classes in the game are completely overpowered compared to the older ones.
-This issue applies to PVP ONLY, not PVE.

PVP is totally broken.
-Ice Sage's Ultimate ability is FAR too good for any class to withstand.
-Chloromancer is COMPLETELY broken (all of his abilities)
-Banners make PVP entirely pay-to-win
-Hit detection is completely broken for most classes (this has to do somewhat with the servers sucking eggs, as mentioned below somewhere...)

Some classes are completely useless in PVE.
-This mostly applies to ranged classes, as almost ALL mobs in the game have strictly melee-based attacks, making them charge head-on at the player, thus ruining strategic sniper-playstyles.

The game is totally pay-to-win (oh right I already said that like 3 times).

Trion (the corporation behind Trove) doesn't listen to their community AT ALL.

The Trove developement team doesn't listen to the community AT ALL.

Trion does not put ANY effort into getting US servers
-All US players are automatically connected to EU servers 95% of the time
-Your ping is ALWAYS 100+ no matter where you live (I've conducted command prompt testing with various servers via pinging Google's servers and measuring speeds between distances)
-The in-game ping measurer is ALWAYS wrong (compared to the above, the in game ping tool states you have 60-70 when in reality you have 100+)

Maintainance is constantly happening (meaning ALL servers are offline)
-On top of that, the back-logging of connecting players after maintainance takes MULTIPLE hours to fully get through (matchmaking servers are TERRIBLY slow)

The individual servers hosting players in game cannot even remain stable (even when maintainance back-logging isn't present)
-Servers will lock-up for 90% of players currently on them even when only 10-15 people are on a single server not doing anything

The trading economy is full of inflation EVERYWHERE (I think I said something like that before)

The whole Dragon Coin system got ♥♥♥♥ed up thanks to Trion
-They claimed the new system of getting dragon coins was easier to new players"
-It's actually about 2.5x harder now
-The new system makes ALL dragon coins untradable

reviewText:
*NOTE* I have way more time in the game than what is shown in my Steam hours, I started playing this game in beta.
Pros:
+ Lots to collect
+ Good variety of dungeons and enviornments to explore and not get too repetitive
+ Some dungeons have parkour which are pretty fun ( unless you have insane jump then you can just cheat to get through them xD)
+ Graphics are nice and game runs pretty smooth on my mid-low tier build
+Ability to get free shop currency by completing dungeons daily
+ Nice building system to prevent from getting griefed
Meh:
=Classes don't have a ton of abilities, no skill trees
= Economy is a bit out of whack
= Steam has brought a ton of jerks to what seemed to be a genuinely nice community
Cons:
- Patron system seems to add a P2W element
- Can feel grindy

Overall: Might update this review in the future but all in all it's not a bad game and as a player of Cubeworld which is pretty much update dead this has filled the gap in my heart. Good fun for people who like MMO's, adventuring, and stuff of the sort.

reviewText:
Fun, this game encourages you to play daily. Of corse you can buy through much of the grinding, but everything in the store that costs real money is way overpriced, so don't buy anything. I bought 750 credits for 5 dollars and could buy almost nothing. I saw that extra backpack space was on saale for 50% off, 250 credits for what i assumed was 50 extra backpack spaces, it was missleading and gave me 5 extra slots... Could not really buy much else with only 500 credits so I bought 10 more slots. The game itself is fun, but be prepared to grind, dungeons, mining, other resources. It takes a long time to progress in the game. I have yet to achive highest tier gear or do a shadow dungeon yet so I have not seen all of the game yet, and the economy and trading scene seems like it is healthy as far as I can tell. I am not great reviewer but I felt like sharing my opinion. But back to the buying things with money, even if everything was half the price, it would not be worth it. So unless you are rich and got cash to burn, buy nothing.

reviewText:
TROVE INSIDE NUTSHELL.
Someone asked 'What's hard about Trove / What's the game in a nutshell' and this is my summary, I'm a level 32 TR with 3 other classes above 15 and have around 75 hours at time of writing this.

Right now its a 50 hour playsink with some wallet warriors ruling the marketplace but its potential is undeniable, I know it's commonly said about MMO's but this game has uniqueness, it's just bland right now. This is my TL:DR of the game

learn the game levels 1-10,

spend your time in uber1-uber5 levels 11-20 getting enough gear level/mastery ranks to enter u6

enter uber-6 and make profit - but the game really ends progressively here

The monsters you kill dont even change in size nor color, it's the same dungeons thousands and thousands of times over. There's masteries and professions and a 'collection' system thats designed to make you feel like therer's infinite progression until you max out but in my small opinion the core gameplay is whats more important, and once youve gotten over the 'holy crap this game is something new and unique', it really starts to feel like youre stuck in a loop until you can afford to financially upgrade your gear.

The game is built on a structure that isnt at all desgined to be hard (Unless you picked Gunslinger or Neon Ninja, and for the sake of time im not going into class balance but holy fk), but only time consuming. The only thing to do is go find materials to create 'x' or to upgrade shadow levels of your gear. Once youre past using the earlier upgrade materials it's expensive as hell to progress and takes 5 hours+ for ONE tier upgrade (even if you make 3K flux/ hr reliably)

what keeps me playing is the club im in is full of ~200 nice/mature/experienced MMO people that make repeating dungeons / repeating mining / repeating shadow arenas at least a bit dynamic and fast, without a group to run with I would have quit already.

I recommend it because the developers are in touch with the community and the promise for the game is there. Club member restrictions need expansion, along with all the other side-aspects of the game. The core is just boring in my humble opinion.

Thanks for the read.

reviewText:
I played a lot of Trove before it came to Steam and participated in Alpha/Beta testing. I have got to say not only has the game changed a lot. it has improved along the way! There are tons of new features, more items and an over all more refined game!

For the uninitiated, Trove is a voxel based sandbox mmo where you create your character and travel through different worlds completing dungeons, collecting loot/gear to progress your character. There are many classes in the game, and more classes added regularly. Each class can be switched to on the fly" all you need is a wardrobe.

In Trove each player gets there own plot of land that they can take with them everywhere they go
date: all from the start! this land can be customized in anyway you can imagine as long as its withing the size limits. There are also shared worlds for building called Clubs
recommended: that act sort of like guilds in other mmos.  Linking all the worlds and features together is the hub. Hubworld is a place most "trovians" pass through regularly to get from place to place
hoursPlayed:
so its always pretty lively.


I completely recommend Trove to anyone who is a fan of voxel based games

reviewText: Trove is a classic grinding MMO, with an option to fast-forward the grinding with real money. The game is fun, the different classes lend some diversity to an otherwise routine game. The enemies balance well with the player level, and the game is paced so as to offer the player a reward at intervals that make it fun and keep the game feeling like an adventure. One of the greatest features is the cornerstone"- your own plot of ground that you can build and outfit as you see fit and move with you as you move from biome to biome.\n\nThe downside is that grinding MMO's require functional servers to enjoy
date: and the developers can't seem to maintain a server or push a patch successfully to save their life. In the past two weeks since I began playing
hoursPlayed:
there was not a day that passed  without the servers going down. Disruptions of less than an hour or 2 do not make the forum ( I think the dev's see them as common) but looking at the forum you can see that the server goes down for long periods at approximately 2 day intervals. (http://forums.trovegame.com/forumdisplay.php?21-Server-Status).


Pros:
Free to play
fun biomes to explore
block building
mobile home base

Cons:
Servers are down regularly
Enemies and bosses lack variety
Game play is repetitive
"

reviewText:
Hello People... First of all it was long time ago since i made a review but ill try to keep it simple for the info that i got so far and Im a Newbie my self in the game i have played for 35 hours and some information might be incorrect and im not even near end game! ^^.

At the first ppl look at the game... oh sh... its a copy of minecraft... well ITS NOT.
The game is basicly allowing you to make a house where you can have your personal stuff like loot and you can spawn your house at worlds with you... you can costumize your own building how ever you want and have working bench and portals and other crafting benches... the house is personal and people can join you and have fun...
What you can do in this game with friends is Going out and Farm monsters and do these Dungeons that is everywhere in the map and gain awesome loot with amazing stats in it. i would say its more like Diablo 3 farming style. you run around in dungeons and get loot and you can share items with others... the loot system is personal but if you find something nice you could take the loot and drop it to a friend if you want to :) and the loot that you get and dont need you turn them into materials for crafting. well i dont really know how to explain it better than this... i would say hey... give it a try and dont read comments like this and just jump into the game and give it a go  :)

The bad thing is atm the Que Timer, but i hope they fix it really soon... its about 1-60 mins long, some times its really not showing the right time and if it says MORE than 60 mins its just lying to you... so dont trust that it can really jump and just lie that its 300 mins in que. just be patient and youll get in to the game. if you havent played TRION WORLDS game and need an account why not take my link to Recruit a friend link for the game its on my Steam page soon.

AND THE GAME IS FREE GUYS! and NOT a pay to win game. just go for it!
and i hope you guys understood any of what i just have written above, english is my third language and i hope you enjoyed my review and thanks for taking the time to read it! and write in comments if theres something incorrect what i wrote about the content of the game!
