reviewText:
This game is just the most fun you can have for free.  At first I was a little confused overwhelmed, it's bright, it's colorful, and sometimes the zone changes can be jarring.  I fell in love the first time I whacked a giant bee with my candy cane like weapon.

I've built a glowing blue pyramid with a crystal ball and a birch tree on top of it as my home.  Oh and it's a roller coaster ride.  I've demolished it and have built something even crazier.  I've turned into a dragon and killed a boss with my fire breath.  I've smashed faries with an ice cream cone.  All this while looking so fabulous.  What free game gives you so many ways to have fun?  If you know of any please tell me.

Yes there has been growing problems since the steam launch and there might be more with the impending Mac Beta launch.  But even waiting through a 20 minute wait time did not damper the great time I had once in game.

You don't have to pay to enjoy the game but if you so chose the option is there.  I have bought a few things for my enjoyment, including a patron's pass  because the game is  pretty rad.  I can afford to spend a few dollars here and there to support a fun game or recieve a cool game item, many people can't, at one point in my life I couldn't.  It is nice to see a great game that is actually free and so much fun.
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: SIMPLE AMAZING! I have NEVER seen a voxel game that plays as well as this, not to mention it's free to play, and you are SHOWERED in beautiful amount of loot, and it is easy enough to go dungeon raiding. All in all, I find it impossible to not like this game, but it has one fault in my oppinion, lack of a community shop system. I know I might be wrong on that and I just haven't found it, but as far as I can tell there is no community market where players can sell their useless gear for resources via a block. However, that is just my two cents on the matter, and I could care less about it. Also there is a beautiful sailing system, mount system, and a balanced crafting system. I honestly see no reason to not play this game, it's free, it's AMAZING how beautiful the graphics are, I honestly can't see a single reason to dislike this game, unless MMOs aren't your cup of tea.

reviewText:
This game is by far the most catchy MMO RPG I have played for a long time. Servers is down now and then, but you really can't complain with it being a free to play game and  A LOT of people try to get online the whole time. Server queues has been fixed a whole lot lately with almost no queue anymore! (When I first played, the queue was 30+ minutes)

NOTE: If you're not into grinding games, then this game might not be for you.

Pros:
- Free to play
- Lot of fun
- Easy to learn, this game is not advanced at all
- Not pay to win
- Multiple classes in case you're done" with your current or get bored
- Possible to get "Premium" credit while progressing in the game
- Beautiful graphics
- Pixel art
date: this game is cubed like Minecraft/CubeWorld
recommended:
and you can make awesome pixel art
- Community created items/dungeons

Cons:
- No PvP (Not yet at least)
- Server crashes

reviewText:
This game is good if you put the time in. I have played more then 7 hours, and made only a small amount. The loading screen the first time you play can take up to an hour, and the game is a crowded mess. Nothing at all like other MMOs of a similar style. This game is free to play, but it is so dependent on money, you can barely make it past elite completely free. I get that that's how realm makes money, but dont make it required. I almost bought something! If you love this chaotic, scrambled, confusing, laggy atrocity...then hey buddy, thats your problem.

You have to sign in to a website to play! another password! If you are an actual gamer, then you know how stressful passwords can be. I dont need one more to remember! A big francise like Ubisoft is one thing, but now small companies are making this double-password ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t!?!?

This is not a Minecraft rip off, or any of that ♥♥♥♥. Hell, wizard 101 was better for gods sake! Dont play this game unless you ♥♥♥♥ money and time, because i'll tell you pal, it is NOT worth it at all!

reviewText:
Unless you're like me who managed to unlock every class as the last patch came around, chances are their new paywall system for you and other new players to play more classes is going to be a massive turnoff.

reviewText:
You need to grind in this game. There's no avoiding that fact, so if you're one who dislikes the repetition of going to the same dungeons (or lairs) which are almost identical again and again, you most probably will not like this game.

However, if you can put that aside, it is actually quite fun. The colours are vibrant, the designs amazing, the weapons customizable, your house movable. It allows for a lot of creative potential. Think Minecraft with Diablo. The creative aspect of building (Minecraft) does not at all interfere with the hack and slash nature of the fighting (Diablo). In fact, they complement each other well when levelling up and progressing.

However, with the pros of both Minecraft and Diablo, it has the cons of both. There is no story, and the dungeons begin to repat itself very quickly. You might find yourself trapped in limbo where you are too strong for Uber 2, but too weak for Uber 3. This is where grinding takes place.

To counter that, friends really help. Get a group of your friends and go hunting, it is really very fun in that aspect. Personally, I think Trove is great for solo play to a certain extent. I don't detest the grinding, but I really think that there should be something else for people to get stronger without the continuous repetition. With friends, it really shines.

7/10

reviewText:
Too grind heavy near the end-game, with nothing of actual substance to grind for. And nothing to achieve for other than more grinding once you hit the Sky Realms.

Not enough content to reccomend at this point of time. But the concept is definitely a hit. Will have a further review once they actually add more content to the end-game other than COLLECT ALL THE THINGS.

Edit: Pros are that building is both made much easier/harder than your regular Minecraft-esque game. Long-range mining + shared blocks makes for much easier block-farming for your creations.
The multi-jump mechanic + lining up block placements also allows for much larger structures to be made in a shorter amount of time. There is a lack of a 'creation' mode like Minecraft though. They could perhaps allow that just in Club Worlds?

reviewText:
After 300+ Hrs in the game.
(This review has been updated 3 times)

Pros:
Many Classes each with its own abilities. There are melee and ranged classes, tanky and dps specialized.
This game is not pay to win and hopefully it will stay that way.
Professions ( Gardening, Ringcrafting, Runecrafting ) each with its own bonus once you reach max lvl at the profession
A lot of mounts, pets, wings, boats
A lot of dungeons and castles - the hardest ones are called shadow arenas and are divided by uber 1/2/3/4/5/6 etc difficulties, each being harder than the previous one.
FISHING!
A lot of character customization abilities - helmet, face, weapon, ring. (ENDLESS)
Great community
Clubs ( Something like clans or guilds )
Everything you do in the game rewards you as you gain mastery points which unlock mastery levels and great rewards.

Cons:
You can pay for classes if you want to obtain them faster. (Doesn't have any impact on playing the game, just makes the classes more difficult to get.)
GRINDING - this game is a grind fest at higher levels.
Gets a bit boring after a long time playing one class. Although when you find a class which suits you, you're good for a long time. :)
NO pvp. (At least for now)
Steep learning curve for new players.

----- Some comments and tips: -----
Max level for a class is lvl 20. Although your level increases as you obtain shadow level gear.
Currently I have 4 max level classes: Neon Ninja, Candy Barbarian (sounds silly but it's strong), Dracolyte and Knight.
My mastery rank: 87
----- If you need any help about the game feel free to add me ingame: Zarlath -----
There is also a plenty of community guides which can help you with pretty much anything.

The graphics might look silly and dumb for many people, but remember that it's the gameplay that matters the most. :) If you have spare time i'd recommend investing it in this game.

10/10 for now.

reviewText:
Trove: Before the Latest Update~Cubits or Credits for Classes
~Level System that was well balanced.
~Rare Dragon Coin find.
~Cheap Dragons Souls, (costes 2 Dragon Coins, 1 Soul and whatever material needed depending on Dragon Type and you recieved 3 Dragon Souls per make)
~Easy going Gameplay for relaxed gamers

Trove: Afer the Update~Dragon Coins, less Rare, Dragons souls cost double Dragon Coins and give only 1 Dragon Soul
~Classes costs Credits only (translation, real money)
~Level System no longer exists, has been replaced with Power Ranking (Robocraft Rip-off if you ask me)
~Gone from relaxing gameplay to overburdened and must Pay to Win
~Might as well make the game no longer free cause the latest update pretty much has done that without legitamately doing so what's the point.

First. It was addicting. Very fun, but with the new updates, it has gone from OK to complete and total Bull. Dragon Souls used to cost 2 Dragon Coins, some Materials depending on Dragon and for your effort you got 3x the Dragon Souls. now they have doubled the Price and made it 4 Dragon Coins per Dragon Sould and you only get 1 Soul. as if changing from the Level System over to the Power Ranking system, which really sucks. You cannot enter as high Realms anymore with your Shadow Level 3 Gear instead you have to be summoned by a friend and then you don't get the loot. so that is total bullcrap. The should have not changed a thing when I started it, cause all they have done now is made it from Play at your own pace, everyone can win, now it has become to Pay to Win, cause when I started, Classes costed credits or cubits, now it's just credits which can only be obtained by buying them through their store. if that is the case, should I spend $100, I better get 1,000,000 of those Credits, cause otherwise it just aint worth it. if you preffer to simply just build and whatever, good luck, cause you still have to farm for the materials. but nothing is made remotely easy anymore. if you had asked me a week or so ago about if you should get Trove, I would have said yes" without a doubt

reviewText:
TL:DR This game is ♥♥♥, and waaaaay more grindy than warframe. Yea, that's a thing.

This will be the first review I have ever written. I mean ever. I don't have the care to write reviews. But this game. No, not this game, the developers, Trion (REMEMBER THEIR NAME SO YOU MAY FOREVER AVOID IT) are the most god awful and plainly stupid people I have ever seen run a business. I actually cannot comprehend how they have made a standing for themselves in the game industry. Now, onto the rant about the game itself. First of all, Trove is a great idea. The classes (for the most part) all work well. Each have a niche but not too much of one as to balance gameplay somewhat well (some classes are highly underpowered however but under the right players fingertips still do alright). The game looks pretty cool, it is cube-like but it has its own style. Almost every dungeon and equip is made by players. After this point, the game becomes worthless. First of all, the learning curve is outrageous. The tutorial is only good for the first 10ish mins of the game then becomes horribly useless in that you either know how to progress or you don't. If you can't figure it out, you suffer. Next, theres like 3 actual currenices but the marketplace (auction house sort of) has at least 6 currencies and people really only use one of them which isnt an 'actual' currency. Because of recent updates (power rank and this new way of getting dragons, an integral part of upgrading the gear you need to make the money you need to fix the first update) it is now impossible to earn classes (except for 2 through mastery) and it is far too hard to actually move at a somewhat acceptable pace in the game (for free anyway). This game has become such a money grab (in literally the TWO WEEKS that i have played) that I'm surprised how its servers aren't already down from non-usage. This game has basically pried free to play players off its feet, and flung them out to the deep abyss of pointless grinding. If anyone reading this has ever played warframe, or even heard jokes about grindframe, just know, trove is at LEAST 4x as grindy. Ive put 400 some hours into warframe. I can grind alright. But this game is too much for me at 80 hours. It would be ok if they just never had power rank. Hell power rank alone was ok, it was do-able, but messing with dragons RUINED progression for free to play.

In review, Trove is cool but Trion is bad, and progression is long unless you have money.

P.S. sorry about any spelling, grammatical, or formatting errors. This is my first review and probably my last if I never find  a development team worse or as bad as Trion.

reviewText:
Waited to start Trove when it was released and i can already see my life slowly dissapearing.

This game is great with great gameplay. Its like LoL and Minecraft had a God-Child. The servers are a bit flooded right now and new accounts might have to wait in a queue, but the wait isnt long and well worth it.

NOTE:I would highly reccomend finding a friend to play with.

---PROS

-The classes in this game are really fun and unique and add a sort of replay value. I can definitely see myself dumping more hours into another character.

-The building is quiet easy and fast to pick up.

-Gorgeous graphics and biomes


---CONS

-A bit grindy at some points, but you get over it after a short break

-Hard to find good loot until you get a higher level

-The tutorial isnt too great

---OVERALL - 9/10

Id reccomend this game to anyone who loves MMOs and Co-Op fun. The great scenery make for an enjoying experience. Thhis game is a little grindy though, but thats to be expected for a MMO.

reviewText:
Can someone invite me to a club ? Someone invite me to sky realm pls. Anyone at sky realm ? Invite me to SA pls. Give me wings pls..... Now when we are done with this, time to actually say something different which is normally unbelievable.

This game took potential of pretty much abandoned Cube world and got a new coat, result ? After some alpha/beta time it went officially full release and it's popularity got through the roof. It has many factors which will keep many players stay late at night (to get those wings).
You would think that after getting those your world will be completely different, wrong mate, it will be completely same so stop f*cking begging for wings it's short process of getting them.Now the next natural part, by the games tutorial-ish quests it is still learning and there is some stuff to understand about the specific part of the quest ''Collect radiant shards'' do people know why it precisely says ''Better get some wings first'' ? Well many don't, to put it simply it means GET THOSE ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ WINGS BEFORE GOING THERE. Why the hell they would said it otherwise ? I agree that getting the portal is really long process, but to get it you need to collect lots of stuff, 1 of them you get by exploring lands a lot, another is through gardening which gets you closer to mastery lvl where you get wings (see how it all fits together ?) and at last you will also have you mighty hero who is at least a bit ready for everything in there (not much atm but hey they're adding stuff no hate here).
Next in line is something which doesn't makes sense because it's one of first things you probably do so screw that. After that trivia quest you are tasked to get yet higher mastery rank to be eligible for challenges. Ooooh yes THE challenges which were crashing servers for some time, fixed now #thankyoutrion, now it's pretty much lagfest because of pretty heavy load on servers and if you hope you'll do challenge in easiest world, nah don't even try, you'll wait for chunks to load and experience constant rollbacks (hopefully this will be fixed or something dunno man can have dreams).
Did you get enough points in challenge to get your dragon caches ? Did you hoped that you open dragon soul, coin or even penta forged ? Did you ? And did you also get a bit of flux and bunch of eyes after horny chest opening ? Then you are fully capable to call yourself a true Trove player.
Now off with ya and go fish dem old boots ye filthy hub huggers.

If someone really cared to read through this which im writing cuz im really bored, then kudos to you mate, just wasted a lot of time you could spend playing or something.
Nothing is meant as hate towards developers just pointing few problems if even.
Final verdict about the game 8/10 old boots, when servers start to rollback and stuff then it's more like 3/10 but nevermind. This game is really good as rpg, trade simulator, guild-like maker (talking about clubs ofc) and i recommend it to anyone to at least try it. Thanks for reading (or skipping you sissy)

reviewText: This game blew me a way, and was 100x better then I expected it to be.\n\nI went into this game thinking it was going to be another cubeworld/minecraft/terraria clone. Looked like it was claiming the same build/explore/craft ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t that every other game had, and I can even be quoted saying Sorry I dragged you into this
date: . I have been playing CS:GO and TF2 and I needed a break from the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t from the low FPS, high ping, and normal PvP ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. This game was free and a very small file size, so I said screw it, let's try it out.\n\nNo other game I have played has been able to keep my attention for this long in a long time. I started playing this game at 10pm on the weekend, and I look down at the clock and it was 6am in the morning. This game is addicting, and fun, and has a little something for everyone. Many people make jokes that this is cubeworld 2.0, and these are all correct. This game is everything we could've wanted from CubeWorld and more. Tons of exploration, tons of things to do with your friends, and the building potential is outta this world. I can't explain to you how much me, and five other friends of mine have been enjoying this game, if you don't believe me, get it. It's free, take a chance, you won't regret it.

reviewText:
Let's get right into it!

Pro's
- Tons of unique creative things to do
- Awesome Random Dungeons (Boss/Monster Zones to Level in)
- Inifinite Cube generated world to explore
- Tons of character classes at launch
- Dedicated dev team at the moment
- Active Updates
- All items in game are created by YOU the community and the dev team (Head, Face, Weapon, etc.)
- Addicting
- Like Minecraft and other pixel games, but original to its own style sorta
- Can play with friends and have a club and build like its your own private Minecraft World
- Nice leveling system and loot system so far, Once you hit 20 you can get more levels with shadow gear
- In-game store I feel is very balanced and nice, Not really a pay to win type of thing

Con's
- Very repetitive leveling
- Servers are still a bit unstable but devs are actively patching and hotifixing
- Can't create a group/party to play with friends yet you have to hit Join under friends list
- Not to much End Game content to do right now, I have high hopes tho for the future
- Very GRINDY!


That's about all I have for now I will keep this updated monthly to ensure users a great experience, Overall it's for sure a great game to dive into right now!

reviewText:
After 300+ Hrs in the game.
(This review has been updated 3 times)

Pros:
Many Classes each with its own abilities. There are melee and ranged classes, tanky and dps specialized.
This game is not pay to win and hopefully it will stay that way.
Professions ( Gardening, Ringcrafting, Runecrafting ) each with its own bonus once you reach max lvl at the profession
A lot of mounts, pets, wings, boats
A lot of dungeons and castles - the hardest ones are called shadow arenas and are divided by uber 1/2/3/4/5/6 etc difficulties, each being harder than the previous one.
FISHING!
A lot of character customization abilities - helmet, face, weapon, ring. (ENDLESS)
Great community
Clubs ( Something like clans or guilds )
Everything you do in the game rewards you as you gain mastery points which unlock mastery levels and great rewards.

Cons:
You can pay for classes if you want to obtain them faster. (Doesn't have any impact on playing the game, just makes the classes more difficult to get.)
GRINDING - this game is a grind fest at higher levels.
Gets a bit boring after a long time playing one class. Although when you find a class which suits you, you're good for a long time. :)
NO pvp. (At least for now)
Steep learning curve for new players.

----- Some comments and tips: -----
Max level for a class is lvl 20. Although your level increases as you obtain shadow level gear.
Currently I have 4 max level classes: Neon Ninja, Candy Barbarian (sounds silly but it's strong), Dracolyte and Knight.
My mastery rank: 87
----- If you need any help about the game feel free to add me ingame: Zarlath -----
There is also a plenty of community guides which can help you with pretty much anything.

The graphics might look silly and dumb for many people, but remember that it's the gameplay that matters the most. :) If you have spare time i'd recommend investing it in this game.

10/10 for now.

reviewText:
I've played Trove since a little bit before its launch, and it's always been a bit hit and miss for me. In the early days, at worse it had a lot of great ideas with poor/careless execution. This slowly degraded to just being mediocre ideas with poor/careless execution, and eventually, to just plain awful ideas.

Overall, Trove is a game about farming for things for the sake of farming for things. Your goals are basically set by your current desires, and the ultimate goal is to get all the things. It's a very pure and simple skinner box and there is absolutely nothing wrong with this if it's what you're after.

There is also a sandboxy construction element where you can build your own home or form a guild with a persistent sandbox mini-world, but it's still very limited and there are MUCH better games you can be doing that on.

As for the gameplay, combat is quite shallow and very repetitive, but there are a lot of classes that all play quite differently and this can keep you going for quite a while, because you want to see what all the classes are capable of.

Except this became a lot harder with an update which made the classes unpurchaseable from the Store using Flux, the game's primary type of earnable currency. You can still buy Class Coins(Normally purchased with premium currency from the Store) from other players for a hefty price, but then they also made earning Flux more difficult in that same update.

Yes, they paywalled the most compelling aspect of what was an otherwise monotonous endless grind, and this quite frankly disgusted me to the point of quitting. I actually own quite a few of the classes, enough to keep myself entertained for quite a while if I was so inclined, but I just couldn't keep playing knowing they did something like this. I'm genuinely curious how long new players will be stuck playing a class before they can afford a single Class Coin, and feel really bad for them.

For the sake of full disclosure, I quit back in January. The only reason I'm writing this review now in March is because Trove popped up in the Steam front page and I was like Oh right
date: it's that one game I got so disgusted with that I uninstalled and completely forgot about until now."\n\nEither way
recommended: it doesn't look like they've changed the class system back so I absolutely cannot recommend this game."

reviewText:
[Review for the February 2016 Update]

TLDR?; Great game, however recent update has changed the entirety of it. Replaced required currency with items that must be collected in mass to even be of use, bosses are harder, weapons are weaker, was time consuming before-hand and is now even more so due to this update.


Let me start off by saying this game is... or was... great. It was utterly amazing, the simplicity was addicting and the gameplay was phenomonal for a stand-alone pixelated 3D MMO, especially for an E-rating. You jump in with an assortment of classes, rank up and get better equipment, meet challenging bosses and see astonishing maps and detailing with the best ranking system I've seen yet, leveling can either be an easy or difficult accomplishment and the best part about it is that you can play this came solo and still find enjoyment no matter what.

Now let's touch the dirty parts of this. Before the update there was an easily obtainable form of currency by Mastery Rank 10 called Flux, this Flux is required in mass numbers to do a number of things such as creating equipment, trading with other players, and even creating neccessary items. There was the harder obtainable Dragon Coins, which were used to purchase Dragon Souls, which upon consumption would give you a Dragon Level. Five would be a pet, ten would be a mount, then the mount would level up as you reach higher levels until you reached a full-fledged dragon that could fly, and give you massive stat boosts. The update switched this. Now, the oh-so require Flux can only be acquired through completing 45 dungeons in twenty to fifteen minutes, which this objective is seen after reaching Master Rank 10. Sounds easy, right? Negative, ghost rider. In order to accomplish this, you must be part of the two bonus classes in the objective. The bonus classes are essentially randomly generated, and they grant a certain class the ability to complete a dungeon and get it counted for three. With out this, you are racing between several worlds for fifteen to twenty minutes, killing several bosses (which can be difficult dependant on your area), all the while trying to even get to them from across the other side of the map. Not only this but you also must beat other players to get there, which some of the more experienced have insane speed boosts due to other mounts, and pay-to-play players have a large boost from this. Some might question, Is this enough to give a bad review
date: though?" Maybe. However there is more. In the recent update
recommended: high leveled items were buffed. Now you may be wondering
hoursPlayed: "Doesn't that contradict your statement that other players have advantages?" No. This is only for weapons
voteText: which do not give you speed buffs. This comes with the problem that the bosses were not buffed
helpfulPercent: they remain the same difficulty. Completing a Shadow Tower is now even harder than it was
votesHelpful: and for those who have not played the game
votesTotal: a Shadow Tower is essentially what you would call an "end-game level". This is for high ranking players
votesFunny: with very powerful weapons. Even with those powerful weapons you must work together. Before the buffing
commentsCount: the bosses were extremely difficult and took several tries to complete
column16: however now it takes a lot more. There's still more to come

You can still buy Class Coins(Normally purchased with premium currency from the Store) from other players for a hefty price, but then they also made earning Flux more difficult in that same update.

Yes, they paywalled the most compelling aspect of what was an otherwise monotonous endless grind, and this quite frankly disgusted me to the point of quitting. I actually own quite a few of the classes, enough to keep myself entertained for quite a while if I was so inclined, but I just couldn't keep playing knowing they did something like this. I'm genuinely curious how long new players will be stuck playing a class before they can afford a single Class Coin, and feel really bad for them.

For the sake of full disclosure, I quit back in January. The only reason I'm writing this review now in March is because Trove popped up in the Steam front page and I was like Oh right
date: it's that one game I got so disgusted with that I uninstalled and completely forgot about until now."\n\nEither way
recommended: it doesn't look like they've changed the class system back so I absolutely cannot recommend this game."

reviewText:
[Review for the February 2016 Update]

TLDR?; Great game, however recent update has changed the entirety of it. Replaced required currency with items that must be collected in mass to even be of use, bosses are harder, weapons are weaker, was time consuming before-hand and is now even more so due to this update.


Let me start off by saying this game is... or was... great. It was utterly amazing, the simplicity was addicting and the gameplay was phenomonal for a stand-alone pixelated 3D MMO, especially for an E-rating. You jump in with an assortment of classes, rank up and get better equipment, meet challenging bosses and see astonishing maps and detailing with the best ranking system I've seen yet, leveling can either be an easy or difficult accomplishment and the best part about it is that you can play this came solo and still find enjoyment no matter what.

Now let's touch the dirty parts of this. Before the update there was an easily obtainable form of currency by Mastery Rank 10 called Flux, this Flux is required in mass numbers to do a number of things such as creating equipment, trading with other players, and even creating neccessary items. There was the harder obtainable Dragon Coins, which were used to purchase Dragon Souls, which upon consumption would give you a Dragon Level. Five would be a pet, ten would be a mount, then the mount would level up as you reach higher levels until you reached a full-fledged dragon that could fly, and give you massive stat boosts. The update switched this. Now, the oh-so require Flux can only be acquired through completing 45 dungeons in twenty to fifteen minutes, which this objective is seen after reaching Master Rank 10. Sounds easy, right? Negative, ghost rider. In order to accomplish this, you must be part of the two bonus classes in the objective. The bonus classes are essentially randomly generated, and they grant a certain class the ability to complete a dungeon and get it counted for three. With out this, you are racing between several worlds for fifteen to twenty minutes, killing several bosses (which can be difficult dependant on your area), all the while trying to even get to them from across the other side of the map. Not only this but you also must beat other players to get there, which some of the more experienced have insane speed boosts due to other mounts, and pay-to-play players have a large boost from this. Some might question, Is this enough to give a bad review

reviewText:
TL:DR This game is ♥♥♥, and waaaaay more grindy than warframe. Yea, that's a thing.

This will be the first review I have ever written. I mean ever. I don't have the care to write reviews. But this game. No, not this game, the developers, Trion (REMEMBER THEIR NAME SO YOU MAY FOREVER AVOID IT) are the most god awful and plainly stupid people I have ever seen run a business. I actually cannot comprehend how they have made a standing for themselves in the game industry. Now, onto the rant about the game itself. First of all, Trove is a great idea. The classes (for the most part) all work well. Each have a niche but not too much of one as to balance gameplay somewhat well (some classes are highly underpowered however but under the right players fingertips still do alright). The game looks pretty cool, it is cube-like but it has its own style. Almost every dungeon and equip is made by players. After this point, the game becomes worthless. First of all, the learning curve is outrageous. The tutorial is only good for the first 10ish mins of the game then becomes horribly useless in that you either know how to progress or you don't. If you can't figure it out, you suffer. Next, theres like 3 actual currenices but the marketplace (auction house sort of) has at least 6 currencies and people really only use one of them which isnt an 'actual' currency. Because of recent updates (power rank and this new way of getting dragons, an integral part of upgrading the gear you need to make the money you need to fix the first update) it is now impossible to earn classes (except for 2 through mastery) and it is far too hard to actually move at a somewhat acceptable pace in the game (for free anyway). This game has become such a money grab (in literally the TWO WEEKS that i have played) that I'm surprised how its servers aren't already down from non-usage. This game has basically pried free to play players off its feet, and flung them out to the deep abyss of pointless grinding. If anyone reading this has ever played warframe, or even heard jokes about grindframe, just know, trove is at LEAST 4x as grindy. Ive put 400 some hours into warframe. I can grind alright. But this game is too much for me at 80 hours. It would be ok if they just never had power rank. Hell power rank alone was ok, it was do-able, but messing with dragons RUINED progression for free to play.

In review, Trove is cool but Trion is bad, and progression is long unless you have money.

P.S. sorry about any spelling, grammatical, or formatting errors. This is my first review and probably my last if I never find  a development team worse or as bad as Trion.

reviewText:
Trove: Before the Latest Update~Cubits or Credits for Classes
~Level System that was well balanced.
~Rare Dragon Coin find.
~Cheap Dragons Souls, (costes 2 Dragon Coins, 1 Soul and whatever material needed depending on Dragon Type and you recieved 3 Dragon Souls per make)
~Easy going Gameplay for relaxed gamers

Trove: Afer the Update~Dragon Coins, less Rare, Dragons souls cost double Dragon Coins and give only 1 Dragon Soul
~Classes costs Credits only (translation, real money)
~Level System no longer exists, has been replaced with Power Ranking (Robocraft Rip-off if you ask me)
~Gone from relaxing gameplay to overburdened and must Pay to Win
~Might as well make the game no longer free cause the latest update pretty much has done that without legitamately doing so what's the point.

First. It was addicting. Very fun, but with the new updates, it has gone from OK to complete and total Bull. Dragon Souls used to cost 2 Dragon Coins, some Materials depending on Dragon and for your effort you got 3x the Dragon Souls. now they have doubled the Price and made it 4 Dragon Coins per Dragon Sould and you only get 1 Soul. as if changing from the Level System over to the Power Ranking system, which really sucks. You cannot enter as high Realms anymore with your Shadow Level 3 Gear instead you have to be summoned by a friend and then you don't get the loot. so that is total bullcrap. The should have not changed a thing when I started it, cause all they have done now is made it from Play at your own pace, everyone can win, now it has become to Pay to Win, cause when I started, Classes costed credits or cubits, now it's just credits which can only be obtained by buying them through their store. if that is the case, should I spend $100, I better get 1,000,000 of those Credits, cause otherwise it just aint worth it. if you preffer to simply just build and whatever, good luck, cause you still have to farm for the materials. but nothing is made remotely easy anymore. if you had asked me a week or so ago about if you should get Trove, I would have said yes" without a doubt

reviewText: Once upon a time, there was a game called Trove. Trove was a wonderous game, filled with a community who loved to build and work together to clear even the hardest of bosses. Everyone worked to help everyone out, and all was well. Sure, the grind for classes and better gear was sometimes tedious, and we had our fair share of trolls, but in the end everyone had fun.\n\nThen came that fateful day in February. There was talk of Trove moving towards a Pay-2-Win model, and the community had protested it. We didn't want to spend real money to get items that were, in the past, available to us for free. With the increase of prices in the shop, classes no longer being purchasable with cubits (a free currency obtained daily), and the class coins being scalped in the market, Trove lost it's allure. Other players felt the same, and many of us quit. The magic of being able to play a MMO without having P2W features shoved down our throat was amazing, and being able to  pick up and play any class with free currency was great. No real-time crafting costs, no money needed to be spent. Now, Patron (the membership" status) was being advertized everywhere

reviewText:
I've played Trove since a little bit before its launch, and it's always been a bit hit and miss for me. In the early days, at worse it had a lot of great ideas with poor/careless execution. This slowly degraded to just being mediocre ideas with poor/careless execution, and eventually, to just plain awful ideas.

Overall, Trove is a game about farming for things for the sake of farming for things. Your goals are basically set by your current desires, and the ultimate goal is to get all the things. It's a very pure and simple skinner box and there is absolutely nothing wrong with this if it's what you're after.

There is also a sandboxy construction element where you can build your own home or form a guild with a persistent sandbox mini-world, but it's still very limited and there are MUCH better games you can be doing that on.

As for the gameplay, combat is quite shallow and very repetitive, but there are a lot of classes that all play quite differently and this can keep you going for quite a while, because you want to see what all the classes are capable of.

Except this became a lot harder with an update which made the classes unpurchaseable from the Store using Flux, the game's primary type of earnable currency. You can still buy Class Coins(Normally purchased with premium currency from the Store) from other players for a hefty price, but then they also made earning Flux more difficult in that same update.

Yes, they paywalled the most compelling aspect of what was an otherwise monotonous endless grind, and this quite frankly disgusted me to the point of quitting. I actually own quite a few of the classes, enough to keep myself entertained for quite a while if I was so inclined, but I just couldn't keep playing knowing they did something like this. I'm genuinely curious how long new players will be stuck playing a class before they can afford a single Class Coin, and feel really bad for them.

For the sake of full disclosure, I quit back in January. The only reason I'm writing this review now in March is because Trove popped up in the Steam front page and I was like Oh right
date: it's that one game I got so disgusted with that I uninstalled and completely forgot about until now."\n\nEither way
recommended: it doesn't look like they've changed the class system back so I absolutely cannot recommend this game."

reviewText:
[Review for the February 2016 Update]

TLDR?; Great game, however recent update has changed the entirety of it. Replaced required currency with items that must be collected in mass to even be of use, bosses are harder, weapons are weaker, was time consuming before-hand and is now even more so due to this update.


Let me start off by saying this game is... or was... great. It was utterly amazing, the simplicity was addicting and the gameplay was phenomonal for a stand-alone pixelated 3D MMO, especially for an E-rating. You jump in with an assortment of classes, rank up and get better equipment, meet challenging bosses and see astonishing maps and detailing with the best ranking system I've seen yet, leveling can either be an easy or difficult accomplishment and the best part about it is that you can play this came solo and still find enjoyment no matter what.

Now let's touch the dirty parts of this. Before the update there was an easily obtainable form of currency by Mastery Rank 10 called Flux, this Flux is required in mass numbers to do a number of things such as creating equipment, trading with other players, and even creating neccessary items. There was the harder obtainable Dragon Coins, which were used to purchase Dragon Souls, which upon consumption would give you a Dragon Level. Five would be a pet, ten would be a mount, then the mount would level up as you reach higher levels until you reached a full-fledged dragon that could fly, and give you massive stat boosts. The update switched this. Now, the oh-so require Flux can only be acquired through completing 45 dungeons in twenty to fifteen minutes, which this objective is seen after reaching Master Rank 10. Sounds easy, right? Negative, ghost rider. In order to accomplish this, you must be part of the two bonus classes in the objective. The bonus classes are essentially randomly generated, and they grant a certain class the ability to complete a dungeon and get it counted for three. With out this, you are racing between several worlds for fifteen to twenty minutes, killing several bosses (which can be difficult dependant on your area), all the while trying to even get to them from across the other side of the map. Not only this but you also must beat other players to get there, which some of the more experienced have insane speed boosts due to other mounts, and pay-to-play players have a large boost from this. Some might question, Is this enough to give a bad review
date: though?" Maybe. However there is more. In the recent update
recommended: high leveled items were buffed. Now you may be wondering
hoursPlayed: "Doesn't that contradict your statement that other players have advantages?" No. This is only for weapons
voteText: which do not give you speed buffs. This comes with the problem that the bosses were not buffed
helpfulPercent: they remain the same difficulty. Completing a Shadow Tower is now even harder than it was
votesHelpful: and for those who have not played the game
votesTotal: a Shadow Tower is essentially what you would call an "end-game level". This is for high ranking players
votesFunny: with very powerful weapons. Even with those powerful weapons you must work together. Before the buffing
commentsCount: the bosses were extremely difficult and took several tries to complete
column16: however now it takes a lot more. There's still more to come

reviewText:
So the game was good until they released the expansion.

They added a gearing system based on Gems, which are completely rng-based, can't be traded and take a whole lot of time and resources to actually optimize for your character.

Before Mantle of Power, your character only had 4 pieces of equipment which you upgraded for progression etc. but that is now almost useless as a good empowered gem, of which you need to have 3, counts almost as much as all the rest of your gear combined towards progression.

Also, before the expansion upgrading gear was linear and straightforward. Gems on the other hand, have a chance to break (which can be fixed with an item of which you can get in the shop with daily currency which is better used elsewhere anyways) when upgrading and will often just use up resources instead of gainig a level, Overall, it just seems as if the developers wanted to milk the game dry, instead of slowly grow/develop progression.

Gems have also seemed to cause an interference with leveling, as, at least for a character that is not very well geared, it is hard to progress without proper gems, and it is impossible to get more gem slots unless you level your character. Also empowered gems are pretty hard to get without spending money or already being geared, and there is always the chance that the gem would have the wrong damage type on it, making it almost useless for your character.

My advice to the devs would be to at least let gems be traded so that at least if rng ♥♥♥♥s someone big time he can still have some use of the gems he farmed for like hours/days, or at least make it so that players can at least choose the damage type of their gems; anything to reduce this awful rng carnage brought by this expansion.

reviewText:
Trove used to be an excellent game it had everything u could want out of a game sure the grinding was hard and you didn't really get a decent reward for your efforts but, you weren't forced to do anything. You could build and get to higher level worlds with realitive ease you could join clubs and enjoy the comunitity, but now that comunitity is very much broken. The game has become pay to play those who can pay quickly trump those who can't. People on this game used to be kind and helpful to each other now it's every man or woman for themselves. Shadow tower which was a team effort to gather supplies and gain things you couldn't get on your own has been ♥♥♥♥ on; those who gain the higher level items whether by extreme amounts of grinding or paying for the quick, and far less metally painful way, can quickly run through the tower by themselves and brag about the things they can get and receive. In pts there was an odd economy but it worked; for ages the left the pts servers up for anyone above level 20 which was the max level at the time to use it and test things but recently they decided that keeping pts open 24/7 wasn't giving them anything so they put heavy modifactions of pts making it almost a game of it's own where only the smartest at finding loop holes survive. The once fun and enjoyible game is dead only the selfish are left on trove. I saw many arguements on the forms of trove's web page during the change and many of them did make any sense but since they were from what was left of the normal live players I guess i could understand. I asked one person how people would get some of the rarer mounts or classes now that it would be pay to play? They said people would put stuff on the market for others... This didn't make sense to me so I asked would people really buy extra for others? You really think they would? They said people would have extra stuff... But how can you have extras now? Even if you were luckly enough to get two of the same mount it's unlikely you will be able to sell it for any decent price. And if you want to do anything as simple a building in the game you have to run around trying to collect recipes.

Average day trying to get started on building:
You wanted colored blocks to build something fun :D? :) to bad you have to level up so you can go to skyrealm... whats that you don't have a skyrealm portal? Thats to bad you have to make a club to use any you make or try and get into a club with one :)... :D you got the portal now? Nice now go through any go look for a dungeon! oh... wait you don't have high enough mastery for wings ;( to bad... guess you have to go try these worlds first and try to get your mastery up... your gear isn't high enough for decent grinding? Well then go grind the lower level world you only get a couple flux for each item you fight to get but thats not a problem right :)? It's been a few hours hows your gear going :D? Only up to relic? ;( to bad all the recipes r uber level you won't have a good time if you go like that you should get at least shadow level 2 even for uber 1... It's been a week did you get it? :D You did?! Great! Now go look for recipes in uber 1... can't find any? Try uber 2 then... you got it :D? Good get as many as you can for those first wings :3! You finally got the wings after a week and a half :D nice! Lets get going then! Wait the game updated and now you can't even get in to skyrealm D;? What you need a high power rank how do you get that? ... so new recipes mounts or leveling.... well leveling is near impossible you can't get new classes you have to pay for those and mounts were nearly impossible to get anyway so that leaves... recipes... you say you already got all the recipes except the seasonal ones? Weeeell if you give me $100 I'll give you the stuff to level up your gear making things easier on you... you don't have $100 well ;(... I hope you like grinding :3 bye bye!

Anyone who wants to can come play creativerse with me it's completely free unless you want fancy blocks and it rewards your efforts giving you as much as you give it my server is called last light arena anyone is welcome to join.

reviewText:
I Dont Write Many Reviews But I Have To Write One For Trove. Before Trove I Thought CSGO, G-Mod And Arma 3 Were The Best Games I've Ever Played.... I Was Wrong. I First Looked At The ScreenShots Of Trove, Thought Meh Looks Bad, And I Didn't Feel Like I Would Get Into It So I Ignored It. After About A Week After Its Release On Steam I Was Pretty Bored With No New Games To Play. (I Use To Play A Lot Of CSGO) SO I Was Like Why Not Try Trove, If I Dont Like It I'll Just Uninstall It. First Hour Or So. Ok Not Bad I'm Liking The Shadow Hunter (My First Class). I Get To Max Class Level(20) And I'm Hooked To The Game. I Can't Stop Playing It Now. I've Been Playing For About 2 Weeks Straight The Date I Have Written This Review And I Cant Stop Playing It Now. At First I Didnt Have Any Friends Playing Trove. So I Started My Own Club, And I Was Having Tons Of Fun With My Club Members And Everything But It Was Still Not Extremely Fun. I Eventually Got A Few Friends To Try Tove Out. They Ended Up Enjoying It Also. So We Started Playing Together. From That Moment The Game Went From 6/10 To 9/10. It Was Almost One Of The Best Games I Have Ever Played. After Some Time More And More Of My Friends Were Getting Trove. Which Meant Larger Groups To Dungeon And Do Shadow Arenas With. And Around That Time My Club Kicked Off And Started To Really Grow. It Got Up To ~80 Members. Which Was Pretty Impressive To Me Since I Never Joined A Club Before Hand To See How A Good Club Is Run. Then From That Point Onward This Game Became The Best Game I Am Yet To have Played And Its Going To Be Hard For A New Game To Come Close. There Is So Much To Do In This Game That You Will Always Have Somthing To Do Everyday. Wether It Be To Get To A Certain Mastery Level, Get A Class To Max Level, Or Get Shadow Weapons From Shadow Arenas To Get Radiant Weapons. There Is JUst So Much To Do And More Is Coming, I Cannot Wait To See Whats To Come. In The End I Would Rate This Game 11/10. If You Are Yet To Play Trove I Would Highly Reccomend You To Atleast Download And Give It A Try. It Does Not Take Very Long To Download And Even Less To Uninstall If You Didnt Like It. If You Are A Fan Of MMORPG Games Such As WOW,Diablo,GW2,etc You Have No Excuess To Not Try This Game Out.

The Only Cons I Can Think Of Are:

The Recent Sudden Hotfixes/Patches.
(They Are Pretty Anoying But If You Get A Max Level Class(20) You Unlock The PTS(Public Test Server) Which Is Up During Live Server Downtime.

(This Game Is Just 3 Weeks Out Of Beta, And The Devs Are Putting A Lot Of Time And Effort Into This Game Even Though It Is A Free To Play So The Sudden Hotfixes Are Understandable)

Also I Know A Lot Of People Who Tried This Game In The Past Hated The Queue Wait Times To Get In The Game Which Were About 30 mins. Guess What... Its History, No More Wait Time At All.

Thats Really About It. Like I Said Before Atleast Give It A Try, Who Knows.... You Might Get Hooked.

reviewText:
Let me start out by saying, this game USED to be good. It was nice that there wasnt too much grinding, it was great and intuitive that your items were what mostly depended on your power and level, not just exp. Let me now tell you what RUINED this once new and explosive game. (BTW if you are a new player I DO NOT RECOMMEND this game. Maybe play it for the experience because when you get to at least u4 and gem RNG you'll want to end your life.)


PVP

Holy guacamole dont even get me started on Class Gem Pirate Captain and darn tooting Ice Sage with instant ability cooldown. At first, I much enjoyed ruining peoples lives as an ice sage. I thought it was hilarious. Then I came across teams with 2-3 ice sages and wanted to end my futile existance. I've quit PVP because of one class. I dont find it fun to enrage people with freezing anymore because I now know what it's like to be on the butt end. Sorry to all whom I froze because I lost all chill (pun intended) when it happened to me.

GEMS and POWER RANK

Want to know how to increase power rank or get to u9? The answer is gems. It used to be farming a bit and upgrading gear, but now your shadow 5 and radiant gear is barely HALF of your Power Rank. This makes me sad. What's even worse is that the RNG on gems is totally freaking ridiculous. A shadow gem (better than relic/resplendant) can have MUCH WORSE stats than a Relic/Resplendant can. Sure, it MIGHT (that is a very very unassured might) have better Power Rank, but still, you'll have to GRIND and GRIND for Gem Dust to upgrade gems just so you can upgrade more to get a tiny bit more Power Rank. This game didnt used to be grinding. It was only softcore farming. RIP all players trying to get over 1200 PR in a short time.

NEW PLAYERS

There arent any. If you're a new player then congrats. You looked at this game and probably said This looks like a cute little softcore RPG! I'll try it out!". I'm so sorry pal. Trove is now a HARDCORE GRINDING RPG THAT ONLY LOOKS CUTE. ON THE INSIDE TRION IS SECRETLY THE GOSH DARN ILLUMINATI (whose servers are on Pluto btw. Trion is a Plutonian name is you didnt know) AND THEY WANT YOU TO PLAY AND PAY AND SPEND ALL YOUR CASH ON GEMS SO YOU CAN HOPE YOU GET GOOD ONES BUT THEN DONT AND HAVE TO PAY TO WIN ALL OVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!

Dear Trion

Dude. What the hoot.

P.S. You've taken a good juicy pinapple of a game

reviewText:
I play the game not on steam. I spent about 25h ingame with many more to come
Some things Trove does somewhat differently:
You can build your house on 'cornerstones'. These are scattered throught the Worlds. The Thing is that they are transfarable. You can 'call' your selfbuild house on every free cornerstone.
Here comes the Blockstlye in play. You can mine any block(with the exeptions of dungeons) and then replace that (Yeah it's Minecraft all over again)
While you have to unlock your classes with money (either ingame currency or realy money) you can switch freely between them at any guven point. They also share the inventrory which can be handy and a cures at the same time. Luckily the inventory for you blocks is a seperat.
the amount of jump you have can be changed with stats just like any other with a min of 2. Not big but I like that.

reviewText:
TL:DR:
This game is the best Cubeworld update so far.

Review:
I picked this game up in beta cause I had just bought Cubeworld, but that game has not been updated for 2 years now, so I was looking for a game similar to it.
The game is beginner friendly with a good tutorial and a healthy playerbase that can anwser your questions if you ask them in global chat (/1). The game has a lot of classes that you can pick from and they all share the same inventory and house(called cornerstone in game).
At the time of this review the servers are a bit unstable but that is to be expected with the huge growth this game has received over the past weeks.

There is a lot to do in the game ranging from solo questing dungeons to doing shadow arena(kind of like a raid) with a bunch of friends and a good profession system with; ringcrafting, gardening, fishing and crafting.
During events in real life, there are events ingame that reward festive mounts and pets.

Basically this game is good, try it out.
If you do, I recommend getting at least one class to level 10 and doing a shadow arena and then make an opinion about this game

8/10 very good game.
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Trove, in my opinon one of the best free games on steam to date. The game currently has 11 classes

Candy Barbarian: The tank of the game who uses 2 melee weapons

Dracolyte: the pyro of the game, has amazing aoe attacks and can become a dragon!

Neon Ninja: Does backflips and goes invisible, What more could you want?

Knight: A worse version of the the candy barbarian, but with a ability that can fully heal you

Fae Trickster: Does huge amounts of damage while dodging most attacks, but if you get hit your Dps turns into a potato

Gunslinger: Shoots guns, can run away fast and jump very high

Tomb Raiser: Summons skeletons to fight for him and can become a ghost

Boomeranger:  Only class in the game able to use 2 types of weapons, a sword and a bow (not at the same time sadly). throws bombs and boomerangs

Pirate Captain: Makes cannons and decoys so you can pelt enemies with a slow gun

Shadow Hunter: Uses a bow to do huge amounts of damage to a single enemy while making traps

Ice Sage: Uses ice attacks to slow down enemies and deal minor damage at the same time


Now The Pros And Cons of the game
Pros
. Amazing game play
.Balanced classes
. Can run on a potato
.Hardly any grinding
.Amazing community
.Reponsive Devs

Cons
.Sometimes the queue's can be 20 minutes-1 hour of waiting, but i just watch something
until then


The game is so good i can only think of the one con and there are so many pros i would be here for day writing
about it. its free but better than most 60 dollar games, so give it a try and i think you will love it <('-')>

reviewText:
If Minecraft, Terraria, and World of Warcraft had a baby.

The only downfall of this game is the waiting queue. HALF an hour to get into the game. But it's worth the wait.

It's a amazing blend of building, adventure, and MMO. I love adventuring the endless worlds finding new player-made items and styles.

This is a game TRUELY built up by the community. Plus, it's not PAY TO WIN. The majority of things in the premium shop (Or whatever) is just VANITY items, and things ARE possible to get without WEEKS of endless grinding.

I give the game a 8/10 for great fun for a long time and server issues. Would dungeon dive again.

reviewText: I'll get this out of the way first, Trove, is a good game. The gameplay is awesome, the gear you loot look absolutley riduculous and funny, you can change yor class anytime you want-for a price, though, and Trove is one of the very few games that uses the free-to-play model correctly, making the in-game purchases an option, and not mandatory. Although, I have 1 slight nitpick: sometimes the game gets to oaction packed, especialy when your fighting and boss because you fight bosses in small, confined rooms. After say, 2 minuets of fighting, the room will be absoulutey filled with explosions and fire. I also have 2 suggestions, maybe they could add in structures that aren't duungeons. Like maybe, towns with npcs. Maybe you could place your base at the town, and you could trade with the npcs. Or maybe they could just add a singleplayer mode. I know, i know, the game is an MMO, but there are players like me who travel alone, and never use the trading system at all. Currently, the closest you have to a singleplayer world are the game's club worlds" worlds where only you and anyone you have on your friends list can access. But I would like the game to have an offline experience just in case any players don't have any friends
recommended: or if online server goes down for maintenence. If we had an offline singleplayer mode
hoursPlayed: players could still play the game while waiting for the servers to be back up. Overall

reviewText:
I loved this game for a while. It was a grind for power and items, but it was fun enough to keep me around. You could pay money to shorten the grind or to make your character look special, but it has always been too much money for what you get IMO and you could get by without spending.

Recently they've made the grind infinitely long to achieve most goals, and they've moved some items behind the paywall. But their prices remain too high. So you basically have to dump a bunch of money into it to get anywhere, or you grind toward fewer goals that now have no end in sight.

They took a big step in the P2W direction. I understand that they are trying to make money, and it's their right, but I'm positive they would've made more and lost fewer players by going about it differently.

I wouldnt recommend playing this game.

Trove was the first Free-to-Play business model I have ever played, and I can assure you its not worth the time to put into this game. So many better games out there. Trust me, skip over this game.

With the new gem system, you literally grind and grind for materials to upgrade your gems to become more powerful. Its an mmorpg so you would expect lots of grind, but the grind comes with NO good outcome. Around mid way of your gems being leveled up, you can do every challenge" in-game". After that
date: there is NOTHING in-game to do but chase the materials to upgrade your gems to max level for absolutly no reason
recommended:
and waste of time. The time it takes to successfully upgrade gems is only put in-game to have players play this game for a longer term. But its simply not worth it.

I feel cheated getting this far in this game.




Free-to-Play business model done completly wrong.

Never again."

reviewText:
Trion Worlds is awful. Really pay to win. Going backwards in that direction even. You used to be able to unlock more classes with a daily currency called cubits, now you must pay real money. And the new gem system. You could buy protecting items for upgrading with cubits, now you can't, and they upped the credits price too. Rip. You can potentially buy almost anything from other players who have paid real money as well but it's really outrageously priced. It's hard to acquire flux and stuff without shelling out real money. They keep making the paid bonuses better and bigger.

The core gameplay is pretty solid. It's... kind of like a very simplified Diablo. You run around and do dungeons and kill things with your 4 types of attacks per class. You find gear that has semirandom stats and upgrade it and stuff. It's fun. There's also building in the form of your personal house that you can summon in hotspots found all over. It's like a house in your pocket. There's also club worlds which are like guilds that you can build your own world. It's cool.

But man this real money garbage being shoved down your throat sucks. It'll only get worse, too. I don't recommend this game.

reviewText:
So here I am to write my simple review!
But first I'm gonna say something:
I just have 100 hours but i been playing since closed alpha and back then It was a AMAZING game!Simple ideia, Great Game, Lot of customization,Good variety of Gameplay,Friendly community, No P2W, etc... But now I think it's just a meh game...I don't know  what it changed but I don't feel the same way about trove like i used to before... And now for my simple review :)

Pros  Good Gameplay

Good Classes(btw #dracolytebestclassever)
Just three ability and one passive but still the abilities are really well made and each class has his own very unique style. Good job on that

Alot of Farming
Grinding,Grinding,Grinding...So much grinding that you will spend hours in dungeons fighting monsters but you better have some friends or this will get repetitive.

Cons Trion Worlds
Wonder why this is a problem?Because this company always ruins their games!Start with a good game with no p2w ellements, then give us good updates and then add p2w and ♥♥♥♥ updates...

Packs.
Really the packs that you can buy for trove is just to steal us money from our pockets but still people don't see that and he keeps buying...

The Heart Attack Edition(Update)
You may wonder:Why a update is in the Cons section?" Well let me tell you...THE GAME TURNED P2W! Before this update you could buy classes with cubits and now Trion says:"♥♥♥♥ we need more money let's put classes just to buy with credits so players can give us more money. I'm sure people will not get mad..."Well I'm mad and I think that really ruined the game...

The chat in the game
Really I remember when this game was in closed alpha and everyone was so nice. Literally you asked for help and someone actually helped you.Something that you didn't knew just asked for help and people helped you...
But now people are so annoying and not helpfull. Some days ago my friend asked for help and people just maked fun of him but thankfully some guy helped him. I know that there are still good people on this game but for now i'm gonna leave this has a con.

The downtimes.
Really waiting 4 to 8 hours just for a update?!?!?Come on you can improve that!

Final Verdict: 6.5/10 Great game but what Trion is doing to him is just bad.With the new P2W update I think this game will shortly die.


"

reviewText:
Pros: decently well made with simple gameplay. No pay to play, but you can if you want to (not that i advise it at all)
gameplay is easy to learn, but harder to master.

Cons: lacks creativity quite a bit. now you may argue that is not the case, but just LOOK at it. It is basically minecraft with common RPG ideas. we could of AT least had a skill tree for our classes, but no, they decided it was better to have only 3 different abilities to use. The gameplay is STRAIGHT farming. all you do is kill, get loot, put loot in loot collector, repeat.
i mean, you could have made it more unique, but because they took all their game mechanics from minecraft, they lost all creative capabilities that came with the mechanics. In minecraft, you swing a sword repeatedly by hitting the same button to kill, not much different here. the fact that they had to resort to using minecraft as a foundation for their game hinders their ability to expand upon it. If you want a decent RPG. look to skyrim and others. while this may be free, games like skyrim will be worth the price. But if you dont have money to spend that's ok too, try out warframe or other games (im going to try alot of them and see which is the best for me, i recommend doing the same). Sure warframe only has four powers per warframe, but there are 18+ frames so far, all of which are free, and most of them not that hard to get and a lot less farm. not to mention warframe powers are usually epic, from charging through enemies and sending them flying, to turning invisible and assassinating them! but as to whether or not this game or that game is good, the only way to know for sure is to try. The only reason i stopped playing was because i saw someone say in their review that somewhere in troves terms of use it says that if you pay for something in the game, for instance: cubits, etc. then they have the right to keep the your card information to use when they please, and was also claiming they took 1,000$ from them, whether this is true or not i do not know, but that comment was soon deleted (likely by trove if they have that ability). whether true or false i do not know, but it is still enough to deter me from playing this game again.

reviewText:
A nice third-person action-rpg with randomly generated world, dungeons, loot and a fully destructible and rebuildable environment. Or a sandbox buliding/crafting mmo with rpg elements and combat.  Either way if you don't mind voxelized graphics and you're a fan of a genre you're most likely going to enjoy it for some time.

While I do recommend trying this game out, it has a pretty big flaw which shortens its replayability in my opinion:
Trove has a huge crafting list and literally thousands of customization options for you blocks, decorations, character equipment parts etc., I'd say this game is pretty solid in terms of 'explore, mine, craft and be creative'-thing. But when it comes to combat and RPG features - it's rather lacking. While there are plently of classes and skill mechanics are polished, each class only has 3 skills(and a class passive) which are unlocked almost immediately and... that's it. There are no talents, no item-modified special effects, no skill changes of any sort. And while equipment stats are randomized, the options are pretty limited.

I like the game so far. It offers great variety but unfortunately it lacks depth.
I just wish there was more of 'RPG' in Trove.

reviewText:
I've Played this game for almost 1 years! (July 2014) And I have to say this game is amazing, I havn't found a Voxel game quite like it, Sure There's Minecraft, SkySaga, and Cubeworld, but They can't hold a flame to this game! This game gives you everything you really want, Mineing, Exploreing, MMO like feel, Loot and treasure, And then there's a whole building area.. Club worlds pretty much a Minecraft Server, but Free!

Sure the game had a rough start on Steam... We beta testers knew this... it was the same way when they went from Alpha to Closed Beta.. then Closed Beta to Open Beta.. The queues were there then too.. Granted it wasn't this scale.. Steam is a very populated area, and the Dev's knew this would happen! Just give the game a few months to fix its server's and it'll be going

Speaking of Dev's, they are some of the best I know, they may be not the most expereinced when it comes to support! and they may not always listen to the community, but when things go bad, They're on top of it within an hour trying to fix what ever the issue is, I've reported several bugs that have been fixed almost immediatly!

Knock on them all you want, The Dev's from Trion are doing the best they can and I support their game!

reviewText:
I have almost 400 hours on record, in what I have always considered an awesome game. Trion took a loved artstyle, gave it a new life, and made something a lot of people have enjoyed.

But then the devs got greedy, and like most F2P titles that I've HEAVILY enjoyed in the past, they've hurt the playerbase with the worse possible update they could dish out.

When I first shared Trove to my friends, I made note that one of the most awesome things Trion did was make the game F2P with microtransactions that only affect how your character looks. Unlike a lot of F2P titles that furiously try and milk the community.

If I was making this review 2 weeks ago, I could give it a thumbs up and recommend it. But as of today, and finding out how greedy they've become, I can do no such thing.

I give this game a thumbs down, and can no longer recommend it to any of my friends.

This is why we dislike microtransactions.
This is why we hate greedy game devs.
This is why we can't have anything nice.

reviewText:
Pros :
-good gameplay
-many unique classes
-good community (for now)
-A successor (although only temperary) to Cube World (cube world isn't abandened and infact it's about to come back)
-Smooth controls
-Good animations

Cons :
-Free to play logic EVERYWHERE
-no skill points (this may sound as an opinion but when you play, it removes too much variety and freedom which this type of game should offer)
-too much grinding
-classes cost too much
-Worlds get boring fast (they are just retextures in the very end, different colors and land formations)
-No restarting an account
-no variety or choice (sure you can choose where to go but no matter what, how you progress has to do with one specific method and your progression always ends up the same)

I could go on about the problems with this game due to the only good things are the main ideas. Cons are EVERYWHERE and due to it being free to play, i'm letting them go. This game is not reccomended to be honest, if you want to grind for hours with the same boring methods then fine by me. This game just took the worst parts out of a free to play game and the worst parts about a mmo rpg while adding their ideas to it. They wanted to make a game with these classes where they adventure around in a blocky world. After that, they just went for what would be the easiest and give them the most money. I only have a small amount of hours on the game so i guess i shouldn't judge, but if i am bored for the 4 hours i played with 2 different characters, then i think this game failed to grip a person in.

In the end, this game is the child of a free to play game and the main ideas of Cube World which are two things that should of never mixed unless you are aiming for the big money and fanbase of people who just play this game due to it being free.

reviewText:
Trove is a bit-block game that is similar to Minecraft, but just like any other MMORPG out there. It still lacks that energy that will leave players hanging on and keep playing. Trove has expanded a lot since the pre-alpha stages, in terms of its UI, game mechanics, classes, and open-world generation. The character classes has adopted the same style as Firefall, where all the classes can be earned by collecting the Cubits (daily-earned currency) and redeeming them. If you're those who loves to collect the collectibles, maybe this game is good for you to continue in search of the items.

What's interesting behind the leveling system in Trove is that, the max Level that can be leveled is Level 20. But to move beyond Level 20, you need to obtain Shadow items, refining it, to further increase this capped level. Where maybe things starts to quite grinding as it goes further. Nevertheless it's not just about the leveling, but there is also Mastery system, where each items you collected or actions you have done in Trove accumulates into this system. So it is beneficial to focus on Mastery first.

Trove has a marvellous open-world generation, that you continue to explore the Uber-worlds. I'm sure none of the worlds are similiar in any sense, since it's a mega world with various biomes merged together. Besides fighting dungeon, you can also actively participate in the Club or Cornerstone, architectural building of blocks. Some of the creative worlds can be seen in forums, like Mario World or Pokemon's Pallet Town. Trove also been always very active in their server maintenance, every Tuesday. They have come out with numerous events and limited period items that allows players to hunt and collect these items.

For network wise, it is still playable for Asian players. Although you will experience a little bit of slow response in preloading of objects. Especially Trove sends objects in chunk that loads the next few segments of land, that is in your camera view. This is very adaptive, as Trove adopts the world generation feature. Similarly for dungeon when it comes to boss-battle, it is preloads it for just that instance, so don't worry about dying out.

So they have fixed the long ques for the most part, there are still random crashes during the top of every hour where the main player base has to rush and do a dragon challenge to get the dragon. reviewText: Trove is a very good game, overall. It is one of the few Free to Play games out there that allows you the ability to have a great time and find and use awesome items, without having to pay any actual money to get anything cool (though you can choose to pay actual money, if you so desire). The art style is rather charming and fun to look at, and provides a beautiful environment wherever you happen to be (until you destroy the land while collecting resources for crafting, of course). You have to create an account to play, which is quick and easy, and as soon as you're in you are free to do what you want. The leveling, crafting, equipment, and class systems are all very well balanced and make every milestone you hit very rewarding. Trove is certainly not the greatest MMORPG out there, but it is incredibly fun, it's free, and playing with your friends (or even random people you meet in the game) is easy and very fun. Definitely a must-play for fans of RPG's of all skill levels. A very solid 8.5/10.

reviewText:
Trove is a very excellent game, and I praise the developers for creating such a game. If you like RRP/MMO type games, but your computer isnt as excellent for running high quality games, I encourage you to get this game. Even if you have a Gaming Desktop, still check it out. There are many unique features inside of Trove, however there are some things that could be touched up.

Cons-
Loading time into a server takes forever (Usually takes me around 30 minutes)
The building feature is bugged (sometimes keeps me in the building settings when switching back)
Some characters are considerably weaker than others
The crafting recipes sometimes go to extreme extents
Teleporting to people has too long of a cooldown

Things you could consider adding in:
Multiple house layouts for the plots
More ways to get in-game currency
Different dungeons, and more that you can't cheat" your way up
A dungeon that you fight bosses consecutively and the bosses get harder

This review goes in to depth of Trove
Basic Details
Trove is a Sandbox massively multiplayer online role-playing game developed and published by Trion Worlds. The game was released on Microsoft Windows on July 9

Gameplay

for example the Tomb Raiser class obtains charges called 'souls' either when a set period of time has passed or when an enemy is defeated. The Tomb Raiser can store up to 3 of these charges at any one time and can expend them using their secondary attack ability to summon NPC character minions to help him in combat. Each classes mechanic is unique and allows for a variety of play styles.

Character Customization
I know most of you people like having costumes and stuff on your characters

Game Environment
The Hub zone is the central Zone in Trove and acts as a meeting place for all players as well as a way of accessing the lower level worlds until players are able to craft their own world portals.
The Hub also includes a selection of crafting stations and an NPC who sells items used for fishing

Clubs!
Clubs are like Guilds
column58:
But they have their own world! The Club world is a zone without dungeons or enemies and is meant to be a central meeting area for members of the club. The Club leader and any other member of sufficient rank can freely build within the zone and can place items normally only placeable within player built homes. Additionally there are some items which can only be placed in Club Worlds.
Players can instantly travel from anywhere within the game straight to their club world.
Club chats allow members within a club to chat to each other. The club chat is accessed through typing "/c#" in chat
