reviewText: The game has a lot of useable potential. When you start out as a free to play you can actually enjoy playing the game for a while without being annoyed by the micro transactions. Although the game does make the purchasable packs add fun to the game, you can get by with only spending max 5 dollars, and that's if you want over 6 hours out of a free to play MMO. The game is pretty well developed as far as the game itself, although network issues are persistent during huge updates or DLC sales. If you want the game described in a nutshell, its WoW, Minecraft edition. The game has so much potential as far as more multiplayer features such as PvP or giant raids on bosses for loot. Everything you get in the game Is relatively satisfying as well. So far there are few gameplay options, but a ton of different variations of each such as different classes, loot, mounts, pets, building, and clubs. For only being around for roughly 3 months this game is phenomenally fun and I would recommend that anybody who enjoys MMOs should seriously try it out. Another very critical aspect of this game's community is the customer/gameplay support. They respond very fast and almost seem as if they weren't 100% copied from a bot who really couldn't give a #@%$. I hope Glyph continues what they do for I see this game becoming a huge success for MMO fans everywhere. Verdict: 93/100 - Crazy awesome potential and can and will play for hours.

reviewText:
I haven't had this game for very long, but so far, it is very enjoyable

First of all, it has a very creative selection of classes to play as, as well as specific biomes for each respective class, excluding a few. It also has really amazing character customization options, as well as the ability to make your gear look like other items of the same type, so if you like the stats, but not the look, you can get the stats and a better looking item at the same time. This game also becomes difficult. From the beginning, the game doesn't hold your hand, the most tutorial you get is a text box in the top right of the screen, which allows the player to roam free until they wish to do the thing the box tells them to. Another thing this game does well is the dungeons. The dungeons in the first few level worlds are very short and simple, very easy to complete, and still overall very enjoyable. When you get to the harder dungeons, however, is when they really start to be interesting. The dungeons have very creative designs, and because of the many different types of enemies, there are many different types of dungeons. In each biome, there's a large dungeon, which is harder and longer, but provides better loot.

This game, does however, have it's flaws, as any game will. While the crafting ui was very easy to use and it works well, gathering the materials to craft things is very VERY time consuming. For example, I have a club world for my friends and I that has a sea of deep regret, which kills you when you touch it. But I wanted to put another biome in place of that. I then gathered enough resources to build a terraformer crafting station, which requires 75 infinium. Infinium is very rare, at least it was at the point in the game I was at. I crafted it, and then realized that I had only crafted the STATION. I still had to gather more ingredients for the actual terraformers. So I figured I'd start looking at the recipes and found out that for ONE TERRAFORMER to create ONE BIOME I needed THREE HUNDRED INFINIUM. It took me about an hour to gather 75 infinium, why did I still need that much more?

But this game is overall very enjoyable, with good dungeon-based gameplay, good loot that can be customized to look like better looking loot, good character options, and a very good club system, which is similar to guilds in WoW. If you're a fan of MMORPG's this game is definitely worth your time, especially because I don't even tend to like MMOs and still enjoy this a lot. And before I forget, I must say that I am a robot pirate captain with a squirrel on my head, a monocle on my face, a gun that looks like a pirate hook, and a mount that just happens to be a velociraptor, AND a house that slightly resembles McDonald's. This game is really freaking awesome.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
So the game's actually pretty fun.
It's basically a mix of Minecraft and any light MMORPG out there.
Lotsa fun in the randomly generated adventure worlds, and it's pretty cool to see the club worlds.

HOWEVER... The game has a pretty awful queue time right now. Expect to wait around 30 minutes or more if you're unlucky.
Once in the game it can have some pretty wild lag spikes and very often you have the familiar minecraft block lag.
The community side of the game is... weird.
It's like it's an MMORPG without any of the expected features, such as different chat tabs (you have to manually write in commands).
Sure, it is a lot like Minecraft, and a lot of people would expect nothing more from this kinda game, but it just feels very out of place this time.
I spent almost an hour looking for a club to join, but I was very confused with what a club was and how I would join a club. I asked around, and no one answered. I got my answers (sorta) from wikis, tried to contact several club members and still failed to join a club.

Conclusion: Pretty sweet little game, but is seriously crippled when it comes to community management... or whatever you'd call it. Still I'll recommend it, 'cause it's free and I'm too damn nice for my own god damn good.

reviewText: This game is everything minecraft tries to be.\nThe amount of gameplay that I have gotten from this whim of a dowlnoad is extrordinary. This is a free game. Yes, it does have micro-transactions (shock horror, the developers need money for their work) but the balance is extremely well executed and my temptations to make inigame purchases have mainly been due to the fact that I feel a little guilty for playing such a great game for free. The battle system is thought out and very playable, and the build mechanics are just about perfect. Personally I quite like the art style but I'll admit it's not the prettiest pear in the basket. The co-op is great fun and fluid and I'm quite looking forward to the upcoming pvp arena. Overall this game is free and what are you waiting for? Magical fairies that can dance and teleport at the same time? Well... They're waiting for you to press that big green button.

reviewText:
Pros:
- Classes are very diverse
- Plenty to do to keep yourself busy
- Platforming in an mmo that's actually fun and works perfectly
- Sooo many mounts
- You can get wings
- Boats
- Fishing
- Sooo many weapons

- Isn't pay 2 win
- Challenging
- Level up pretty quick (until after about level 15)
- The Trove world is massive and there's over 8 different biomes
- You can build your own home anyway you please
- You can build your own WORLD anyway you please
- Raids
- Lots of dungeon variety
- Lots of boss variety

Cons:
- No PvP (Honestly this could be good or bad your pick)
- When building your house you can only build it within a limited amount of space
- Combat can get pretty repetitive as you have very limited abilities and attacks

My opinion: I can almost guarantee you'll love this game it's a great MMO. Yes it looks childish, but you can look past it when you realize how much goes into this game and how much fun it is. I'd recommend this to any MMO player.

reviewText:
In short, it's an amazing game and was well beyond my expectations. I hadn't been following this, heard of it, or anything like that. I opened steam, saw it, saw it was free, right amount of boredom, and gave it a shot thinking I was about to play yet another take on Minecraft that'll entertain me for an hour or two before moving on. Here I am a day later waiting in an hour queue on a Monday morning just to play this game. If only it wasn't summer and kids were still in school... :D

Pros:
- Excellent class/battle/dungeon/rpg system
- I'm a ninja, and it plays.. like a ninja. Plenty of cool classes to pick from.
- Although I don't ever use it, I started off with a mount.
- Love the item/craft system. I'm only lvl 7 or so and I've already found so many random, unique item drops.
- Break down items to obtain its style so you can always have what you thought looked the coolest
- Neat house/cornerstone system. Bring your house wherever your adventures take you.
- It's free.

Cons:
- Waiting in a queue to play (Not a big deal, but it's hard to find something wrong with the game so far)

reviewText:
Once the server issues are solved i think this game deserves to go up in reviews score, Why you ask?
1) Fun gameplay with variety of classes and fun to use mechanics ( aka jump, fly, even hitting enemies and looting ).
2) Unlike Minecraft and other builder games this game has a built in system with progress. You level up gain better gear do harder dungeons and raids, and the big advantage here is that its really easy to get into and play with others.
3)The loot is shared/instanced and i mean all of it, even while mining! This ofcouse makes team play even more fun, and people go on mining togheter, doing dungeons etc...
4)Crafting progress - The game has 3 proffesions you can progress with ( runecrafting / Ringcrafting / Gardening ), and probably more to come.
5) Building - I never got into minecraft but from watching youtube videos about it and comparing to this game i think they are on the same level at the least.
6) Its size is really small!  So what are you waiting for then? Go and download the game and try it yourself : ).

reviewText:
Note that I've been around since Alpha and to this day it's still one of the better f2p mmos I've played. So I'll go over the Pros and Cons with you and what I also expect to change;

PROS:
+11 classes to choose from, all varying in playstyle, appearance and feel.
+Easy to switch classes on the fly, no need for alt characters and all levels contribute to mastery level which is just another bar entirely to get more stuff and cosmetics for your account
+Arcade like feel that is incredibly light hearted and doesn't take itself seriously
+The Cash shop is not p2w but Cosmetics that are key. Almost all cosmetics can be traded with one another. The only thing that can't be bought with the free in game money or traded is Chest slots, which could also be bought using free credits from the mastery system (But honestly if you know what you're doing and know how to get around that Chest slots aren't needed anyway)
+Constantly updated with content and events
+Content is also easily digestible in bite sized pieces. You can play for about an hour and feel like you're not missing much
+Each class is designed for soloing in mind

CONS:
-As of recently the Dragon event has kind of broken the player Economy of using Flux by making 20 minute challenges on the hour drop caches that have insane amount of flux and eyes. It's manageable still but it has significantly skyrocketted prices
-This was also bound to happen because aside from upgrading Flux is near worthless for anything else. It needs to be added to more recipes
-Classes do not have much variation within their own class, for example; there's no way to make anything other than a tanky Tomb Raiser that's any good. So every class has a predetermined set up of allies and emblems that will work the best for them
-The grind is real, if you want to access the end game" content
date: which is U5-U6 Shadow Arenas and worlds; you will have to grind for a lot of flux and hope for Twice forged+ souls. And Penta Souls
recommended:
which is the last things you need to upgrade your gear to max shadow to make radiant only ever seem to drop from the challenge caches.
-Servers are still a bit wonky from the initial steam release. Queue times are a bit much from everybody logging in at once. This is to be a bit expected as before last week we didn't even have any other servers save for NA.
-Because there's no fixed economy things fluctuate from person to person. What's worth 1k to one person may be worth 3-4k to another. Naturally this just involves a bit of patience and bartering as well as watching prices.

Overall
hoursPlayed: Developes have expressed concerns for the Servers
voteText: the flux crash as well as the overarching content and they are working round the clock to try and make things right. Avarem has an ear for the community and usually listens to people's qualms and complaints.\n\nTL;DR it has a few kinks to work out but it's a very free and fair game and don't expect this review to always be like this"

reviewText:
This game is at its base, a dungeon fighter. you go from place to place finding dungeon in an open world to go through and fight. Some are small and simple, others are large and complex, at the end of them you fight a boss and collect loot from a chest which you can equipt to your player. there are many biomes and each has their own items, dungeons, enemies, and terrain.

As of writing this there are 11 classes and you get two at the start of playing, the knight class, and one of your picking out of all but three classes. All items can be obtained without buying anything in the game, either by saving up cubits (the games free credit that you earn by playing daily or by doing quests) or by trading with other players (mainly using flux, the game's main upgrade meterial)

The game, while looking like most voxel based games feels unlike many. The closest thing I could compare it to is Cube World and that's still in beta and not updated very much(twice a year it seems), this game is updated quite a lot and have a decent support.

It is an MMO but it's easy to get with friends, playing with friends is easy and helpful, item-drops are client side so there is no item stealing like in other MMOs, there is to be a PvP added in the steam release but i've not tried it so I can't say anything about it.

Each class can be leveled up to level 20 but can have a higher level depending on the gear they have on, they can all be bought with cubits meaning you can get any and all without paying a dime. There are multiple portals" to diffrent worlds based on a classes level
recommended: adept for 4-5 expert for 6-7 and master 8-10

reviewText:
I've been religiously playing Trove since it's infancy in November of 2013.  I've seen the game progress in deveolopment, and can happily say that I am more than content with what it is today.

Trove is, in my eyes, an Adventuring Game with an emphasis on Collection.  Collect mounts, boats, sails, allies, weapons, styles, hats, masks, classes, and materials.   Trove offers Runecrafting, Farming, Building, and Ring-forging for activities other than killing things.   Trove obviously draws inspiration from Zelda, and old-school dungeon crawlers.

The game is a solid experience, even without paying a dime, which is hard to find for an MMO these days, especially a Free-to-Play one.

I reccomend giving trove a try, it's a VERY small download, and it's free.  If you decide you like it, hit me up in game and I'll be happy to help get you started. (IGN is Kwongger).

reviewText:
Trove is a very excellent game, and I praise the developers for creating such a game. If you like RRP/MMO type games, but your computer isnt as excellent for running high quality games, I encourage you to get this game. Even if you have a Gaming Desktop, still check it out. There are many unique features inside of Trove, however there are some things that could be touched up.

Cons-
Loading time into a server takes forever (Usually takes me around 30 minutes)
The building feature is bugged (sometimes keeps me in the building settings when switching back)
Some characters are considerably weaker than others
The crafting recipes sometimes go to extreme extents
Teleporting to people has too long of a cooldown

Things you could consider adding in:
Multiple house layouts for the plots
More ways to get in-game currency
Different dungeons, and more that you can't cheat" your way up
A dungeon that you fight bosses consecutively and the bosses get harder

One last thing! Acheivements on steam would be AWESOME! ;D

I recommend it! It's fun!

reviewText:
This game is good, Like really good. Lemme Explain

The dungeon system may be a little repetitive but its worth it because the loot you gain from it pushes you to go on and see and do more dungeons,
The areas/biomes are great in the way it differs with the ore and items and even enimes found there. Some have a happy atmosphere and others have a gloomy atomsphere, it make for all the better adventuring
This game is great when it comes to Co/op and playing with friends, being able to make a club world,and a friend club helps  you communicate and have a good time with them.
Leveling feels odd in the way its stacked, I'm a big fan of it, yet it still feels a bit odd.
Combat does feel like spam clicking at times, but being able to use abilites help out (despite only being able to use 2, if you count the M2 ability)

Over all this game is a blast! I have had only 18 hours on it yet its the best F2P I've played in a while. So Enjoy it!

reviewText:
Note that I've been around since Alpha and to this day it's still one of the better f2p mmos I've played. So I'll go over the Pros and Cons with you and what I also expect to change;

PROS:
+11 classes to choose from, all varying in playstyle, appearance and feel.
+Easy to switch classes on the fly, no need for alt characters and all levels contribute to mastery level which is just another bar entirely to get more stuff and cosmetics for your account
+Arcade like feel that is incredibly light hearted and doesn't take itself seriously
+The Cash shop is not p2w but Cosmetics that are key. Almost all cosmetics can be traded with one another. The only thing that can't be bought with the free in game money or traded is Chest slots, which could also be bought using free credits from the mastery system (But honestly if you know what you're doing and know how to get around that Chest slots aren't needed anyway)
+Constantly updated with content and events
+Content is also easily digestible in bite sized pieces. You can play for about an hour and feel like you're not missing much
+Each class is designed for soloing in mind

CONS:
-As of recently the Dragon event has kind of broken the player Economy of using Flux by making 20 minute challenges on the hour drop caches that have insane amount of flux and eyes. It's manageable still but it has significantly skyrocketted prices
-This was also bound to happen because aside from upgrading Flux is near worthless for anything else. It needs to be added to more recipes
-Classes do not have much variation within their own class, for example; there's no way to make anything other than a tanky Tomb Raiser that's any good. So every class has a predetermined set up of allies and emblems that will work the best for them
-The grind is real, if you want to access the end game" content
date: which is U5-U6 Shadow Arenas and worlds; you will have to grind for a lot of flux and hope for Twice forged+ souls. And Penta Souls
recommended:
which is the last things you need to upgrade your gear to max shadow to make radiant only ever seem to drop from the challenge caches.
-Servers are still a bit wonky from the initial steam release. Queue times are a bit much from everybody logging in at once. This is to be a bit expected as before last week we didn't even have any other servers save for NA.
-Because there's no fixed economy things fluctuate from person to person. What's worth 1k to one person may be worth 3-4k to another. Naturally this just involves a bit of patience and bartering as well as watching prices.

Overall
hoursPlayed: Developes have expressed concerns for the Servers
voteText: the flux crash as well as the overarching content and they are working round the clock to try and make things right. Avarem has an ear for the community and usually listens to people's qualms and complaints.\n\nTL;DR it has a few kinks to work out but it's a very free and fair game and don't expect this review to always be like this"

reviewText:
In short, it's an amazing game and was well beyond my expectations. I hadn't been following this, heard of it, or anything like that. I opened steam, saw it, saw it was free, right amount of boredom, and gave it a shot thinking I was about to play yet another take on Minecraft that'll entertain me for an hour or two before moving on. Here I am a day later waiting in an hour queue on a Monday morning just to play this game. If only it wasn't summer and kids were still in school... :D

Pros:
- Excellent class/battle/dungeon/rpg system
- I'm a ninja, and it plays.. like a ninja. Plenty of cool classes to pick from.
- Although I don't ever use it, I started off with a mount.
- Love the item/craft system. I'm only lvl 7 or so and I've already found so many random, unique item drops.
- Break down items to obtain its style so you can always have what you thought looked the coolest
- Neat house/cornerstone system. Bring your house wherever your adventures take you.
- It's free.

Cons:
- Waiting in a queue to play (Not a big deal, but it's hard to find something wrong with the game so far)

reviewText:
Once the server issues are solved i think this game deserves to go up in reviews score, Why you ask?
1) Fun gameplay with variety of classes and fun to use mechanics ( aka jump, fly, even hitting enemies and looting ).
2) Unlike Minecraft and other builder games this game has a built in system with progress. You level up gain better gear do harder dungeons and raids, and the big advantage here is that its really easy to get into and play with others.
3)The loot is shared/instanced and i mean all of it, even while mining! This ofcouse makes team play even more fun, and people go on mining togheter, doing dungeons etc...
4)Crafting progress - The game has 3 proffesions you can progress with ( runecrafting / Ringcrafting / Gardening ), and probably more to come.
5) Building - I never got into minecraft but from watching youtube videos about it and comparing to this game i think they are on the same level at the least.
6) Its size is really small!  So what are you waiting for then? Go and download the game and try it yourself : ).

reviewText:
Trove is a bit-block game that is similar to Minecraft, but just like any other MMORPG out there. It still lacks that energy that will leave players hanging on and keep playing. Trove has expanded a lot since the pre-alpha stages, in terms of its UI, game mechanics, classes, and open-world generation. The character classes has adopted the same style as Firefall, where all the classes can be earned by collecting the Cubits (daily-earned currency) and redeeming them. If you're those who loves to collect the collectibles, maybe this game is good for you to continue in search of the items.

What's interesting behind the leveling system in Trove is that, the max Level that can be leveled is Level 20. But to move beyond Level 20, you need to obtain Shadow items, refining it, to further increase this capped level. Where maybe things starts to quite grinding as it goes further. Nevertheless it's not just about the leveling, but there is also Mastery system, where each items you collected or actions you have done in Trove accumulates into this system. So it is beneficial to focus on Mastery first.

Trove has a marvellous open-world generation, that you continue to explore the Uber-worlds. I'm sure none of the worlds are similiar in any sense, since it's a mega world with various biomes merged together. Besides fighting dungeon, you can also actively participate in the Club or Cornerstone, architectural building of blocks. Some of the creative worlds can be seen in forums, like Mario World or Pokemon's Pallet Town. Trove also been always very active in their server maintenance, every Tuesday. They have come out with numerous events and limited period items that allows players to hunt and collect these items.

For network wise, it is still playable for Asian players. Although you will experience a little bit of slow response in preloading of objects. Especially Trove sends objects in chunk that loads the next few segments of land, that is in your camera view. This is very adaptive, as Trove adopts the world generation feature. Similarly for dungeon when it comes to boss-battle, it is preloads it for just that instance, so don't worry about dying out.

reviewText:
Trove......oh trove. What a wonderful but horrible game. It has SO much potential, but it really ruined the game with the simple grind system it has.

When I first downloaded the game, I thought it was going to be one of these pay 2 win mmorpgs. I was right, however there was a whole another level where it failed. Well I'll first start off when you go in the game. You are given a class token which you can unlock any given class in the game. Getting to the good part, the classes are pretty neat, like the boomeranger can use boomerangs to stun their enemies and finish them off with a bomb of rabid chickens. Yeah... The graphics are great since many computers can run this game and my friend with a really low-tier computer can run this game 60 fps no problem.

Now..getting to the bad parts.

Well, this game has a HORRIBLE GRINDING MECHANIC. IT MAKES ME SO MAD HOW MUCH POTENTIAL THIS  GAME HAD BUT THEY RUINED IT BY IMPLEMENTING THIS. To further explain this mechanic, the whole game is just going into dungeons and going back out. You might think this, hey these dungeons are pretty cool maybe their like the ones in World of Warcraft where you go in do a couple inside the dungeon and beat these huge npcs! Well...no World of Warcraft...is World of Warcraft.  Trove...is well ♥♥♥♥. The dungeons are literally killing mobs and killing the boss over and over and over again. THERE ISNT EVEN A TON OF VARIETY WITH THESE DUNGEONS ITS LITERALLY ALMOST THE SAME EXACT THING OVER AND OVER AGAIN.


The game is fun for a while and exploring the new biomes in dungeons and the occasional shadow dungeon which is rly fun. But after 3 hours of playing the game.... its ♥♥♥♥. But is there any quests? No...cuz its ♥♥♥♥. How can there be no quests??? Cuz its ♥♥♥♥. But its free isn't it? Well yeah...but its pay to play, if you want to be really good. Flasks that are in the game give you these over powered powers like getting health off hurting a enemy or giving a shield that makes you invincible for a long time.

Now....for the spells. Most of the classes that have spells only have 3 SPELLS. 3 SPELLS. AND THE OTHER 2 CLASSES HAVE 4 SPELLS....THATS HOW SIMPLE THIS GAME IS. Now if you want to play this ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game for yourself, go ahead its free and you can feel the pain I had when playing this game.

Until the developers add quests, more variety and things to do in this game I will not recommend this game... at all.

Please don't even waste space for this game until its fixed and in the meantime invest your money in a good mmorpg,
H3X

reviewText: Fun game.  Kinda like Minecraft and Skyrim mixed (witch added features).  You start off choosing a class. There's a lot to choose from from Shadow Hunter (Archer) to Knight to Candy Barbarian (Tank) to Ice Sage (Cyromancer or Ice Mage) to Draco something to Pirate Captain. You can buy more classes from doing missions, leveling your mastery rank, etc. Or you can buy Credits and support the game and get cool stuff. There's a lot to talk about and a lot to do. Try this game out, it's worth it. If it's not your playstyle, it's not. But at least you tried it, right?

reviewText: I played this game for about an hour a couple of days ago. Seemed fun. Nice crafting system, nice combat system, and an all together smooth game. I felt like playing today. Good idea! Nope. queue time went from 30 minutes to 20 minutes to 180 minutes back down to 6 minutes then back up to 36 minutes! A great game, but the queue's a pain.

reviewText: As an experimental gamer I found this game quite fun. However, there is one key issue with the game that everyone will experience. The current issue at hand is lag. I dont know where the server's are located but if you and a friend play this game expect it. There will be moments where you will get disconnected when entering a portal. Moments when you will stand there and wait a minute before actually accessing the portal. Seeing as how this is the only piece of uncertainty to not download this game. I would definatly reccomend the game because ive been playing it for a week straight non-stop.\n\nThose of you with any questions or concerns go ahead and drop a comment on my profile. If i find this question reasonable i will add you and discuss it.

reviewText: This game is addicting and just makes you determined to do the best you can. The game is very social, you can play with a group of friends each taking a different class, or even solo if you like to. The pixel graphics are no problem at all, and even if you reach the maximum level there's still an unending amount of goals you can reach! The best thing about this game is that, even though there are missions to complete, you make your own goals! You can decide to do whatever you want and be whatever you want, you can be a strong solo tank who can also work with a group or a support ice sage which people will want you to help them. There are an unlimited amount of possibilities on this game! The most amazing part of this game is the social interaction, you can join different chats for every subject e.g. you can use '/join trade' to join the trade chat if you wanna buy or sell something! The game has a large community of players which are all friendly! If you decide to play this game, i hope you enjoy your experience as much as i have
